41 namespace legup {
42 
43 void GenerateRTL::updateOperationUsage(
44  std::map<std::string, int> &_OperationUsage) {
45  for (std::map<std::string, int>::iterator i =
46  OperationUsageFunction.begin(), e = OperationUsageFunction.end();
47  i != e; ++i) {
48  std::string OpName = i->first;
49  if (_OperationUsage.find(OpName) == _OperationUsage.end()) {
50  _OperationUsage[OpName] = i->second;
51  } else {
52  _OperationUsage[OpName] += i->second;
53  }
54  }
55 }
56 
57 void GenerateRTL::setOperationUsageFunction(Instruction *instr) {
58  //mem related instr should not be counted
59  //as it isn't an "operation" with an fmax/area.
60  if (isMem(instr))
61  return;
62 
63  std::string OpName = LEGUP_CONFIG->getOpNameFromInst(instr, alloc);
64  if (OperationUsageFunction.find(OpName) == OperationUsageFunction.end()) {
65  OperationUsageFunction[OpName] = 1;
66  } else {
67  OperationUsageFunction[OpName] += 1;
68  }
69 }
70 
71 std::string GenerateRTL::verilogName(const Value &val) {
72  return verilogName(&val);
73 }
74 
75 // return the unique Verilog identifier for val
76 std::string GenerateRTL::verilogName(const Value *val) {
77  // keep global updated
78  return alloc->verilogNameFunction(val, Fp);
79 }
80 
81 // get ram from a GetElementPtrInst, or getElementPtr constant
82 RAM* GenerateRTL::getRam(Value *op) {
83  const Value *ram;
84 
85  DEBUG(errs() << "getRam: " << *op << "\n");
86 
87  ram = op;
88  if (const User *U = dyn_cast<User>(op)) {
89  if (U->getNumOperands() > 1) {
90  ram = U->getOperand(0);
91  }
92  }
93  return alloc->getRAM(ram);
94 }
95 
96 //NC changes... wrapper function
97 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getGEP(State *state, User *GEP) {
98  int offsetValue = 0;
99  return getGEP(state, GEP, offsetValue);
100 }
101 
102 // get ram address from a GetElementPtrInst, or getElementPtr constant
103 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getGEP(State *state, User *GEP, int &value) {
104 
105  int baseValue = 0;
106  RTLSignal *basePointer = getOp(state, GEP->getOperand(0), baseValue);
107  //RTLWidth w("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1");
108  //basePointer->setWidth(w);
109 
110  int offsetValue = 0;
111  RTLSignal *offset = getGEPOffset(state, GEP, offsetValue);
112  if (!offset) {
113  value = baseValue;
114  return basePointer;
115  }
116 
117  // add offset to base pointer
118  RTLOp *gep;
119  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("GROUP_RAMS")
120  && LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("GROUP_RAMS_SIMPLE_OFFSET")
121  && basePointer->isConst()) {
122  // We can OR these cases where basePointer is a TAG:
123  // gep = (`TAG_g_mem | (4 * offset));
124  gep = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or);
125  } else {
126  gep = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Add);
127  }
128  value = baseValue + offsetValue;
129  gep->setOperand(0, basePointer);
130  gep->setOperand(1, offset);
131 
132  return gep;
133 }
134 
135 //NC changes... wrapper
136 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getGEPOffset(State *state, User *GEP) {
137  int value = 0;
138  return getGEPOffset(state, GEP, value);
139 }
140 
141 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getGEPOffset(State *state, User *GEP, int &value) {
142 
143  RTLSignal *gepOffset = NULL;
144 
145  gep_type_iterator GTI = gep_type_begin(GEP);
146  for (User::op_iterator i = GEP->op_begin() + 1, e = GEP->op_end(); i != e;
147  ++i, ++GTI) {
148  Value *Op = *i;
149 
150  int offsetValue = 0;
151  RTLSignal *offset = getByteOffset(state, Op, GTI, offsetValue);
152  if (!offset)
153  continue;
154 
155  if (!gepOffset) {
156  gepOffset = offset;
157  value = offsetValue;
158  } else {
159  RTLOp *newGepOffset = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Add);
160  newGepOffset->setOperand(0, gepOffset);
161  newGepOffset->setOperand(1, offset);
162  int newGepOffsetValue = value + offsetValue;
163  RTLWidth w("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1");
164  gepOffset->setWidth(w);
165  gepOffset = newGepOffset;
166  value = newGepOffsetValue;
167  }
168  }
169 
170  return gepOffset;
171 }
172 
173 //NC changes... wrapper
174 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getByteOffset(State *state, Value *Op,
175  gep_type_iterator GTI) {
176  int offsetValue = 0;
177  return getByteOffset(state, Op, GTI, offsetValue);
178 }
179 
180 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getByteOffset(State *state, Value *Op,
181  gep_type_iterator GTI, int &offsetValue) {
182 
183  // Build a mask for high order bits.
184  const DataLayout* TD = alloc->getDataLayout();
185  unsigned IntPtrWidth = TD->getPointerSizeInBits();
186  uint64_t PtrSizeMask = ~0ULL >> (64 - IntPtrWidth);
187 
188  // apply mask
189  uint64_t Size = TD->getTypeAllocSize(GTI.getIndexedType()) & PtrSizeMask;
190 
191  RTLWidth w("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1");
192  RTLOp *offset = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Mul);
193  offset->setOperand(0, rtl->addConst(utostr(Size), w));
194  offsetValue = Size;
195 
196  if (ConstantInt *OpC = dyn_cast<ConstantInt>(Op)) {
197  if (OpC->isZero()) {
198  offsetValue = 0;
199  return NULL;
200  }
201 
202  // Handle a struct index, which adds its field offset.
203  if (StructType *STy = dyn_cast<StructType>(*GTI)) {
204 
205  offsetValue = TD->getStructLayout(STy)->getElementOffset(
206  OpC->getZExtValue());
207 
208  return rtl->addConst(
209  utostr(
210  TD->getStructLayout(STy)->getElementOffset(
211  OpC->getZExtValue())), w);
212  }
213 
214  offset->setOperand(1, getConstantSignal(OpC));
215  offsetValue *= OpC->getValue().getSExtValue();
216 
217  } else {
218 
219  int op1Value = 0;
220  offset->setOperand(1, getOp(state, Op, op1Value));
221  offsetValue *= op1Value;
222  }
223 
224  return offset;
225 
226 }
227 
228 bool GenerateRTL::fromSameState(Value *v, State *state) {
229  // never gets called
230  assert(0);
231  errs() << "fromSameState: " << *v << "\n";
232  Instruction *operand = dyn_cast<Instruction>(v);
233  if (!operand || isa<AllocaInst>(operand)) {
234  return false;
235  }
236 
237  errs() << "fromSameState: " << *operand << "\n";
238  //if (isa<LoadInst>(operand)) return false;
239 
240  if (sched->getFSM(Fp)->getEndState(operand) == state) {
241  return true;
242  } else {
243  return false;
244  }
245 }
246 
247 // does the value 'v' finish in another state?
248 bool GenerateRTL::fromOtherState(Value *v, State *state) {
249  Instruction *operand = dyn_cast<Instruction>(v);
250  if (!operand)
251  return false;
252  if (isa<PHINode>(operand))
253  return true;
254 
255  if (sched->getFSM(Fp)->getEndState(operand) != state) {
256  return true;
257  } else {
258  return false;
259  }
260 }
261 
262 bool GenerateRTL::usedSameState(Value *instr, State *state) {
263  // never called
264  assert(0);
265  for (Value::user_iterator i = instr->user_begin(), e = instr->user_end();
266  i != e; ++i) {
267  Instruction *use = dyn_cast<Instruction>(*i);
268  if (!use)
269  continue;
270  if (sched->getFSM(Fp)->getEndState(use) == state) {
271  return true;
272  }
273  }
274  return false;
275 }
276 
277 // is the value 'val' used in a state other than 'state'?
278 bool GenerateRTL::usedAcrossStates(Value *val, State *state) {
279  for (Value::user_iterator i = val->user_begin(), e = val->user_end(); i != e;
280  ++i) {
281  Instruction *use = dyn_cast<Instruction>(*i);
282  if (!use)
283  continue;
284  if (sched->getFSM(Fp)->getEndState(use) != state) {
285  return true;
286  }
287  }
288  return false;
289 }
290 
291 // like getOp but instead of returning a wire,
292 // returns a register
293 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getOpReg(Value *v, State* state) {
294  if (rtl->exists(verilogName(v) + "_reg")) {
295  RTLSignal *reg = rtl->find(verilogName(v) + "_reg");
296  return reg;
297  } else {
298  return getOp(state, v);
299  }
300 }
301 
302 void GenerateRTL::createMultiPumpMultiplierFU(Instruction *AxB,
303  Instruction *CxD) {
304 
305  // create multipump
306  /*
307  multipump multipump_inst (
308  .clk( clk ),
309  .clk2x( clk2x ),
310  .clk1x_follower( clk1x_follower ),
311 
312  .inA( main_1_6_reg_wire ),
313  .inB( 32'd12 ),
314  .outAxB( main_encode_exit__crit_edge_phitmp_wire ),
315 
316  .inC( main_1_5_reg_wire ),
317  .inD( -32'd44 ),
318  .outCxD( main_encode_exit__crit_edge_phitmp29_wire )
319  );
320  */
321 
322  // registers retain their value so we just need
323  // to connect up the divider
324  RTLModule *m = rtl->addModule("multipump", "multipump_" + verilogName(AxB));
325 
326  // add a comment
327  std::string tmp;
328  raw_string_ostream Out(tmp);
329  Out << "/* " << getValueStr(AxB) << "\n" << getValueStr(CxD) << "*/";
330  m->setBody(Out.str());
331 
332  m->addIn("clk")->connect(rtl->find("clk"));
333  m->addIn("clk2x")->connect(rtl->find("clk2x"));
334  m->addIn("clk1x_follower")->connect(rtl->find("clk1x_follower"));
335 
336  Value *vop0 = AxB->getOperand(0);
337  Value *vop1 = AxB->getOperand(1);
338 
339  // in many cases for a 64-bit multiply, only 32-bit operands are required
340  unsigned sizeAxB = max(MBW->getMinBitwidth(vop0),
341  MBW->getMinBitwidth(vop1));
342 
343  vop0 = CxD->getOperand(0);
344  vop1 = CxD->getOperand(1);
345 
346  // in many cases for a 64-bit multiply, only 32-bit operands are required
347  unsigned sizeCxD = max(MBW->getMinBitwidth(vop0),
348  MBW->getMinBitwidth(vop1));
349  assert(sizeAxB == sizeCxD);
350 
351  //RTLWidth width(AxB->getType());
352  RTLWidth width(sizeAxB);
353 
354  MultipumpOperation &multipumpAxB = multipumpOperations[AxB];
355  RTLSignal *inA_wire = rtl->addWire(multipumpAxB.op0, width);
356  m->addIn("inA")->connect(inA_wire);
357 
358  RTLSignal *inB_wire = rtl->addWire(multipumpAxB.op1, width);
359  m->addIn("inB")->connect(inB_wire);
360 
361  RTLSignal *outAxB_actual = rtl->addWire(
362  multipumpAxB.name + "_outAxB_actual", RTLWidth(sizeAxB * 2));
363 
364  m->addOut("outAxB")->connect(outAxB_actual);
365 
366  RTLOp *trunc = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Trunc);
367  trunc->setCastWidth(getBitWidth(AxB->getType()));
368  trunc->setOperand(0, outAxB_actual);
369 
370  RTLSignal *outAxB = rtl->addWire(multipumpAxB.out, trunc->getWidth());
371  outAxB->connect(trunc);
372 
373  MultipumpOperation &multipumpCxD = multipumpOperations[CxD];
374  RTLSignal *outCxD_actual = rtl->addWire(
375  multipumpCxD.name + "_outCxD_actual", RTLWidth(sizeAxB * 2));
376 
377  m->addOut("outCxD")->connect(outCxD_actual);
378 
379  RTLOp *trunc2 = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Trunc);
380  trunc2->setCastWidth(getBitWidth(CxD->getType()));
381  trunc2->setOperand(0, outCxD_actual);
382 
383  RTLSignal *outCxD = rtl->addWire(multipumpCxD.out, trunc2->getWidth());
384  outCxD->connect(trunc2);
385 
386  RTLSignal *en = rtl->addWire("lpm_mult_" + verilogName(CxD) + "_en");
387  m->addIn("clken")->connect(en);
388 
389  RTLSignal *inC_wire = rtl->addWire(multipumpCxD.op0, width);
390  m->addIn("inC")->connect(inC_wire);
391 
392  RTLSignal *inD_wire = rtl->addWire(multipumpCxD.op1, width);
393  m->addIn("inD")->connect(inD_wire);
394 
395  //m->addParam("size", utostr(getBitWidth(AxB->getType())));
396  m->addParam("size", utostr(sizeAxB));
397 
398  if (sizeAxB < getBitWidth(AxB->getType()) && isa<SExtInst>(vop0)
399  && isa<SExtInst>(vop1)) {
400  m->addParam("sign", "\"SIGNED\"");
401  } else {
402  m->addParam("sign", "\"UNSIGNED\"");
403  }
404 
405 }
406 
407 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::createMulFU(Instruction *instr, RTLSignal *op0,
408  RTLSignal *op1) {
409  /*
410  lpm_mult lpm_mult_component (
411  .clock (clk2x),
412  .dataa (dataa_wire),
413  .datab (datab_wire),
414  .result (dsp_out),
415  .aclr (1'b0),
416  .clken (1'b1),
417  .sum (1'b0));
418 
419  defparam
420  lpm_mult_component.lpm_hint = "DEDICATED_MULTIPLIER_CIRCUITRY=YES,MAXIMIZE_SPEED=5",
421  lpm_mult_component.lpm_representation = "SIGNED",
422  lpm_mult_component.lpm_type = "LPM_MULT",
423  lpm_mult_component.lpm_pipeline = 0,
424  lpm_mult_component.lpm_widtha = 32,
425  lpm_mult_component.lpm_widthb = 32,
426  lpm_mult_component.lpm_widthp = 64;
427  */
428 
429  // registers retain their value so we just need
430  // to connect up the divider
431  RTLModule *d = rtl->addModule("lpm_mult", "lpm_mult_" + verilogName(instr));
432 
433  // add a comment
434  std::string tmp;
435  raw_string_ostream Out(tmp);
436  Out << "/* " << getValueStr(instr) << "*/";
437  d->setBody(Out.str());
438 
439  Value *vop0 = instr->getOperand(0);
440  Value *vop1 = instr->getOperand(1);
441 
442  const Type *T = vop0->getType();
443  unsigned origSize = T->getPrimitiveSizeInBits();
444 
445  // in many cases for a 64-bit multiply, only 32-bit operands are required
446  unsigned size = max(MBW->getMinBitwidth(vop0), MBW->getMinBitwidth(vop1));
447 
448  std::string sign = "\"UNSIGNED\"";
449 
450  if (size < origSize) {
451  RTLOp *trunc_op0 = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Trunc);
452  trunc_op0->setCastWidth(size);
453  trunc_op0->setOperand(0, op0);
454  RTLSignal *a = rtl->addWire("lpm_mult_" + verilogName(instr) + "_a",
455  RTLWidth(size));
456  a->connect(trunc_op0);
457 
458  RTLOp *trunc_op1 = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Trunc);
459  trunc_op1->setCastWidth(size);
460  trunc_op1->setOperand(0, op1);
461 
462  RTLSignal *b = rtl->addWire("lpm_mult_" + verilogName(instr) + "_b",
463  RTLWidth(size));
464  b->connect(trunc_op1);
465 
466  if (isa<SExtInst>(vop0) && isa<SExtInst>(vop1)) {
467  sign = "\"SIGNED\"";
468  }
469 
470  d->addIn("dataa")->connect(a);
471  d->addIn("datab")->connect(b);
472  } else {
473  d->addIn("dataa")->connect(op0);
474  d->addIn("datab")->connect(op1);
475  }
476 
477  RTLSignal *FU_actual = rtl->addWire(
478  "lpm_mult_" + verilogName(instr) + "_out_actual",
479  RTLWidth(size * 2));
480 
481  d->addOut("result")->connect(FU_actual);
482 
483  RTLSignal *FU = rtl->addWire("lpm_mult_" + verilogName(instr) + "_out",
484  RTLWidth(origSize));
485 
486  RTLOp *trunc = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Trunc);
487  trunc->setCastWidth(FU->getWidth());
488  trunc->setOperand(0, FU_actual);
489 
490  FU->connect(trunc);
491 
492  RTLSignal *en = rtl->addWire(getEnableName(instr));
493 
494  unsigned pipelineStages = Scheduler::getNumInstructionCycles(instr);
495  if (pipelineStages == 0) {
496  RTLSignal *NONE = rtl->addConst("");
497  d->addIn("clock")->connect(NONE);
498  } else {
499  d->addIn("clock")->connect(rtl->find("clk"));
500  }
501  d->addIn("aclr")->connect(ZERO);
502  d->addIn("clken")->connect(en);
503  d->addIn("sum")->connect(ZERO);
504 
505  d->addParam("lpm_pipeline", utostr(pipelineStages));
506 
507  // multiplier input sizes must be the same in LLVM
508  d->addParam("lpm_widtha", utostr(size));
509  d->addParam("lpm_widthb", utostr(size));
510 
511  // product width must be double
512  d->addParam("lpm_widthp", utostr(size * 2));
513 
514  d->addParam("lpm_representation", sign);
515  //lpm_mult_component.lpm_hint = "DEDICATED_MULTIPLIER_CIRCUITRY=YES,MAXIMIZE_SPEED=5",
516  d->addParam("lpm_hint", "\"\"");
517 
518  return FU;
519 }
520 
521 unsigned GenerateRTL::getOpSizeShared(Instruction *instr, RTLSignal *op,
522  unsigned opIndex) {
523  assert(
524  (opIndex == 0 || opIndex == 1)
525  && "opIndex has to be 0 or 1 since instr should be a div or rem");
526  unsigned minSize = op->getWidth().numBits(rtl, alloc);
527  unsigned maxMinSize = minSize;
528  std::string fuId = "";
529  if (this->binding->existsBindingInstrFU(instr))
530  fuId = this->binding->getBindingInstrFU(instr);
531  if (fuId != ""
532  && instructionsAssignedToFU.find(fuId)
533  != instructionsAssignedToFU.end()) {
534  for (std::set<Instruction *>::iterator i =
535  instructionsAssignedToFU[fuId].begin(), ie =
536  instructionsAssignedToFU[fuId].end(); i != ie; ++i) {
537  Instruction *thisInstr = *i;
538  RTLSignal *thisSig = rtl->findExists(
539  verilogName(thisInstr->getOperand(opIndex)));
540  if (thisSig)
541  maxMinSize = thisSig->getWidth().numBits(rtl, alloc);
542  else if (USE_MB
543  && MBW->bitwidthIsKnown(thisInstr->getOperand(opIndex))) {
544  maxMinSize = MBW->getMinBitwidth(
545  thisInstr->getOperand(opIndex));
546  } else
547  continue;
548  if (maxMinSize > minSize) {
549  minSize = maxMinSize;
550  }
551  }
552  }
553  return minSize;
554 }
555 
556 RTLWidth GenerateRTL::getOutSizeShared(Instruction *instr) {
557  RTLWidth w;
558  if (USE_MB && MBW->bitwidthIsKnown(instr)) {
559  w = RTLWidth(instr, MBW);
560  unsigned size = MBW->getMinBitwidth(instr);
561  std::string fuId = "";
562  if (this->binding->existsBindingInstrFU(instr))
563  fuId = this->binding->getBindingInstrFU(instr);
564  if (fuId != ""
565  && instructionsAssignedToFU.find(fuId)
566  != instructionsAssignedToFU.end()) {
567  for (std::set<Instruction *>::iterator i =
568  instructionsAssignedToFU[fuId].begin(), ie =
569  instructionsAssignedToFU[fuId].end(); i != ie; ++i) {
570  Instruction *thisInstr = *i;
571  unsigned thisMinSize = MBW->getMinBitwidth(thisInstr);
572  if (thisMinSize > size) {
573  size = thisMinSize;
574  w = RTLWidth(thisInstr, MBW);
575  }
576  }
577  }
578  } else {
579  w = RTLWidth(instr->getType());
580  }
581  return w;
582 }
583 
584 // Instantiate a pipelined divider module
585 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::createDivFU(Instruction *instr, RTLSignal *op0, RTLSignal *op1) {
586 
587 
588  std::set<Instruction *>::iterator instIter;
589 
590  RTLModule *d;
591 
592  // registers retain their value so we just need
593  // to connect up the divider
594 
595  // We support TWO styles different divider implementations:
596  // 1) Altera's LPM divider
597  // 2) A generic divider from opencores.org
598 
599  // We are keeping both options available, because the Altera one
600  // seems to use less Si area
601 
602  std::map<std::string, std::string> nm; // port name map
603  nm["width_d"] = "width_d";
604  nm["width_n"] = "width_n";
605  nm["sign_d"] = "sign_d";
606  nm["sign_n"] = "sign_n";
607  nm["quotient"] = "quotient";
608  nm["remain"] = "remain";
609  nm["clock"] = "clock";
610  nm["clken"] = "clken";
611  nm["numer"] = "numer";
612  nm["denom"] = "denom";
613  nm["stages"] = "stages";
614  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameter("DIVIDER_MODULE") == "generic") {
615  // Figure out if this is a signed or unsigned unit
616  // For the generic case, there are separate Verilog modules for
617  // signed vs unsigned. For the Altera case, there's only a single module.
618  if (instr->getOpcode() == Instruction::SDiv
619  || instr->getOpcode() == Instruction::SRem) {
620  nm["module"] = "div_signed";
621  } else {
622  nm["module"] = "div_unsigned";
623  }
624  } else {
625  assert (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameter("DIVIDER_MODULE") == "altera");
626  nm["module"] = "lpm_divide";
627  nm["width_d"] = "lpm_widthd";
628  nm["width_n"] = "lpm_widthn";
629  nm["sign_d"] = "lpm_drepresentation";
630  nm["sign_n"] = "lpm_nrepresentation";
631  nm["stages"] = "lpm_pipeline";
632  }
633 
634  d = rtl->addModule(nm["module"], nm["module"] + "_" + verilogName(instr));
635 
636  // add a comment
637  std::string tmp;
638  raw_string_ostream Out(tmp);
639  Out << "/* " << getValueStr(instr) << "*/";
640  d->setBody(Out.str());
641 
642  RTLSignal *FU = rtl->addWire("lpm_divide_" + verilogName(instr) + "_temp_out",
643  RTLWidth(instr->getType()));
644 
645  RTLSignal *unused = rtl->addWire(verilogName(instr) + "_unused",
646  RTLWidth(instr->getType()));
647 
648  if (isDiv(instr)) {
649  d->addOut(nm["quotient"])->connect(FU);
650  d->addOut(nm["remain"])->connect(unused);
651  } else {
652  assert(isRem(instr));
653  d->addOut(nm["quotient"])->connect(unused);
654  d->addOut(nm["remain"])->connect(FU);
655  }
656 
657  RTLSignal *en = rtl->addWire(getEnableName(instr));
658 
659  d->addIn(nm["clock"])->connect(rtl->find("clk"));
660  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameter("DIVIDER_MODULE") == "altera")
661  d->addIn("aclr")->connect(ZERO);
662  d->addIn(nm["clken"])->connect(en);
663 
664  unsigned pipelineStages = Scheduler::getNumInstructionCycles(instr);
665 
666  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameter("DIVIDER_MODULE") == "generic") {
667  // janders note the "-1" for generic divider
668  // This is because in the generic divider, if the width is 16, it actually takes 17 cycles to complete its work.
669  pipelineStages = pipelineStages - 1;
670  }
671 
672  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameter("DIVIDER_MODULE") == "altera") {
673  // Check whether this divider should be multi-cycled or pipelined
674  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("MULTI_CYCLE_REMOVE_REG_DIVIDERS")) {
675  // Will insert multi-cycle constraints for this divider after binding
676  alloc->add_multicycled_divider(instr);
677  } else {
678  }
679  } else {
680  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("MULTI_CYCLE_REMOVE_REG_DIVIDERS")) {
681  errs() << "Generic dividers not supported with MULTI_CYCLE_REMOVE_REG_DIVIDERS set.\n";
682  exit(-1);
683  }
684  }
685 
686  d->addParam(nm["stages"], utostr(pipelineStages));
687 
688 
689  // numerator/denominator sizes must be the same in LLVM
690  std::string sign = "\"UNSIGNED\"";
691  if (instr->getOpcode() == Instruction::SDiv || instr->getOpcode() == Instruction::SRem)
692  sign = "\"SIGNED\"";
693 
694  //Get the size of the numerator
695  unsigned size = op0->getWidth().numNativeBits(rtl, alloc);
696  unsigned minSize = getOpSizeShared(instr, op0, 0);
697  if (USE_MB) {
698  bool op0Signed = op0->getWidth().getSigned();
699  op0->setWidth(RTLWidth(minSize, size, op0Signed));
700  if (sign == "\"SIGNED\"" && !op0Signed && !(size == minSize)) {
701  minSize++;
702  }
703  size = min(minSize, size);
704  if (size == 1)
705  errs() << "minSize:" << utostr(minSize) << "\n";
706  }
707 
708  d->addIn(nm["numer"], RTLWidth(size))->connect(op0);
709 
710  FU->setWidth(RTLWidth(size));
711  if (!isDiv(instr))
712  unused->setWidth(RTLWidth(size));
713 
714  d->addParam(nm["width_n"], utostr(size));
715 
716  size = instr->getOperand(1)->getType()->getPrimitiveSizeInBits();
717  minSize = getOpSizeShared(instr, op1, 1);
718  if (USE_MB) {
719  bool op1Signed = op1->getWidth().getSigned();
720  op1->setWidth(RTLWidth(minSize, size, op1Signed));
721  if (sign == "\"SIGNED\"" && !op1Signed && !(size == minSize)) {
722  minSize++;
723  }
724  size = min(size, minSize);
725  }
726 
727  d->addIn(nm["denom"], RTLWidth(size))->connect(op1);
728 
729  if (isDiv(instr))
730  unused->setWidth(RTLWidth(size));
731  else
732  FU->setWidth(RTLWidth(size));
733 
734  d->addParam(nm["width_d"], utostr(size));
735 
736  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameter("DIVIDER_MODULE") != "generic") {
737  d->addParam(nm["sign_d"], sign);
738  d->addParam(nm["sign_n"], sign);
739  }
740 
741  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameter("DIVIDER_MODULE") == "altera") {
742  d->addParam("lpm_hint", "\"LPM_REMAINDERPOSITIVE=FALSE\"");
743  }
744 
745  RTLWidth w = getOutSizeShared(instr);
746 
747  RTLSignal *FUout = rtl->addWire("lpm_divide_" + verilogName(instr) + "_out",w);
748  FUout->connect(FU);
749  return FUout;
750 }
751 
752 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::createFPFU(Instruction *instr, RTLSignal *op0,
753  RTLSignal *op1, unsigned opCode) {
754  // registers retain their value so we just need
755  // to connect up the FP cores
756 
757  int width = instr->getOperand(0)->getType()->getPrimitiveSizeInBits();
758 
759  assert(width == 32 || width == 64);
760 
761  std::string name;
762  switch (opCode) {
763  case Instruction::FDiv:
764  name = "altfp_divider";
765  break;
766  case Instruction::FAdd:
767  name = "altfp_adder";
768  break;
769  case Instruction::FSub:
770  name = "altfp_subtractor";
771  break;
772  case Instruction::FMul:
773  name = "altfp_multiplier";
774  break;
775  }
776  if (width == 64) {
777  name = name + utostr(width);
778  }
779 
780  return createFP_FU_Helper(name, instr, op0, op1, /*fu_module=*/NULL);
781 }
782 
783 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::createFPFUUnary(Instruction *instr, RTLSignal *op0,
784  unsigned opCode) {
785 
786  int width = instr->getOperand(0)->getType()->getPrimitiveSizeInBits();
787 
788  std::string name;
789  switch (opCode) {
790  case Instruction::FPTrunc:
791  name = "altfp_truncate";
792  break;
793  case Instruction::FPExt:
794  name = "altfp_extend";
795  break;
796  case Instruction::FPToSI:
797  name = "altfp_fptosi";
798  break;
799  case Instruction::SIToFP:
800  name = "altfp_sitofp";
801  CastInst *I = dyn_cast<CastInst>(instr);
802  width = I->getDestTy()->getPrimitiveSizeInBits();
803  break;
804  }
805 
806  assert(width == 32 || width == 64);
807 
808  if (!(isa<FPTruncInst>(instr) || isa<FPExtInst>(instr))) { // trunc/ext do not spec width
809  name = name + utostr(width);
810  }
811 
812  return createFP_FU_Helper(name, instr, op0, /*op1*/NULL, /*fu_module=*/NULL);
813 }
814 
815 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::createFCmpFU(Instruction *instr, RTLSignal *op0,
816  RTLSignal *op1) {
817 
818  int width = instr->getOperand(0)->getType()->getPrimitiveSizeInBits();
819 
820  assert(width == 32 || width == 64);
821 
822  int latency = Scheduler::getNumInstructionCycles(instr);
823 
824  std::string name = "altfp_compare" + utostr(width) + "_" + utostr(latency);
825 
826  RTLModule *d = rtl->addModule(name, name + "_" + verilogName(instr));
827 
828  RTLSignal *FU = createFP_FU_Helper(name, instr, op0, op1, /*fu_module=*/d);
829 
830  RTLSignal *unused = rtl->addWire(verilogName(instr) + "_unused",
831  RTLWidth(instr->getType()));
832 
833  if (const FCmpInst *cmp = dyn_cast<FCmpInst>(instr)) {
834  switch (cmp->getPredicate()) {
835  case FCmpInst::FCMP_OEQ:
836  case FCmpInst::FCMP_UEQ:
837  d->addOut("aeb")->connect(FU);
838  d->addOut("aneb")->connect(unused);
839  d->addOut("alb")->connect(unused);
840  d->addOut("aleb")->connect(unused);
841  d->addOut("agb")->connect(unused);
842  d->addOut("ageb")->connect(unused);
843  d->addOut("unordered")->connect(unused);
844  break;
845  case FCmpInst::FCMP_ONE:
846  case FCmpInst::FCMP_UNE:
847  d->addOut("aeb")->connect(unused);
848  d->addOut("aneb")->connect(FU);
849  d->addOut("alb")->connect(unused);
850  d->addOut("aleb")->connect(unused);
851  d->addOut("agb")->connect(unused);
852  d->addOut("ageb")->connect(unused);
853  d->addOut("unordered")->connect(unused);
854  break;
855  case FCmpInst::FCMP_OLT:
856  case FCmpInst::FCMP_ULT:
857  d->addOut("aeb")->connect(unused);
858  d->addOut("aneb")->connect(unused);
859  d->addOut("alb")->connect(FU);
860  d->addOut("aleb")->connect(unused);
861  d->addOut("agb")->connect(unused);
862  d->addOut("ageb")->connect(unused);
863  d->addOut("unordered")->connect(unused);
864  break;
865  case FCmpInst::FCMP_OLE:
866  case FCmpInst::FCMP_ULE:
867  d->addOut("aeb")->connect(unused);
868  d->addOut("aneb")->connect(unused);
869  d->addOut("alb")->connect(unused);
870  d->addOut("aleb")->connect(FU);
871  d->addOut("agb")->connect(unused);
872  d->addOut("ageb")->connect(unused);
873  d->addOut("unordered")->connect(unused);
874  break;
875  case FCmpInst::FCMP_OGT:
876  case FCmpInst::FCMP_UGT:
877  d->addOut("aeb")->connect(unused);
878  d->addOut("aneb")->connect(unused);
879  d->addOut("alb")->connect(unused);
880  d->addOut("aleb")->connect(unused);
881  d->addOut("agb")->connect(FU);
882  d->addOut("ageb")->connect(unused);
883  d->addOut("unordered")->connect(unused);
884  break;
885  case FCmpInst::FCMP_OGE:
886  case FCmpInst::FCMP_UGE:
887  d->addOut("aeb")->connect(unused);
888  d->addOut("aneb")->connect(unused);
889  d->addOut("alb")->connect(unused);
890  d->addOut("aleb")->connect(unused);
891  d->addOut("agb")->connect(unused);
892  d->addOut("ageb")->connect(FU);
893  d->addOut("unordered")->connect(unused);
894  break;
895  default:
896  llvm_unreachable("Illegal FCmp predicate");
897  }
898  }
899 
900  return FU;
901 }
902 
903 // this helper function creates an RTLModule named fu_name (unless you
904 // pass in an RTLModule *fu_module). Connects the dataa and datab
905 // ports to op0 and op1 respectively. Also creates the clock enable
906 // signals. Arguments: op1 and fu_module are optional (set to NULL to ignore
907 // them)
908 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::createFP_FU_Helper(std::string fu_name,
909  Instruction *instr, RTLSignal *op0, RTLSignal *op1,
910  RTLModule *fu_module) {
911  // registers retain their value so we just need
912  // to connect up the FP cores
913 
914  RTLSignal *FU = rtl->addWire(fu_name + "_" + verilogName(instr) + "_out",
915  RTLWidth(instr->getType()));
916 
917  // module is specified for altfp_compare which has special output ports
918  if (fu_module == NULL) {
919  int latency = Scheduler::getNumInstructionCycles(instr);
920  fu_name = fu_name + "_" + utostr(latency);
921 
922  fu_module = rtl->addModule(fu_name, fu_name + "_" + verilogName(instr));
923  fu_module->addOut("result")->connect(FU);
924  }
925 
926  // add a comment
927  std::string tmp;
928  raw_string_ostream Out(tmp);
929  Out << "/* " << getValueStr(instr) << "*/";
930  fu_module->setBody(Out.str());
931 
932  // enable signal
933  create_fu_enable_signals(instr);
934  RTLSignal *en = rtl->addWire(getEnableName(instr));
935 
936  fu_module->addIn("dataa",
937  RTLWidth(op0->getWidth().numNativeBits(rtl, alloc)))
938  ->connect(op0);
939  if (op1) {
940  fu_module->addIn("datab",
941  RTLWidth(op1->getWidth().numNativeBits(rtl, alloc)))
942  ->connect(op1);
943  }
944  fu_module->addIn("clock")->connect(rtl->find("clk"));
945  fu_module->addIn("clk_en")->connect(en);
946 
947  return FU;
948 }
949 
950 // create a functional unit (fu) module instantiation for the given
951 // instruction and input operand signals
952 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::createFU(Instruction *instr, RTLSignal *op0,
953  RTLSignal *op1) {
954 
955  if (isDiv(instr) || isRem(instr)) {
956  return createDivFU(instr, op0, op1);
957  } else if (EXPLICIT_LPM_MULTS && alloc->useExplicitDSP(instr)) {
958  return createMulFU(instr, op0, op1);
959  }
960 
961  //If the instruction is one of the floating point operation, call FP create module
962  //with opCode (unsigned) as additional parameter
963  unsigned opCode = instr->getOpcode();
964  switch (instr->getOpcode()) {
965  case Instruction::FAdd:
966  case Instruction::FSub:
967  case Instruction::FMul:
968  case Instruction::FDiv:
969  return createFPFU(instr, op0, op1, opCode);
970  case Instruction::FCmp:
971  return createFCmpFU(instr, op0, op1);
972  case Instruction::FPTrunc:
973  case Instruction::FPExt:
974  case Instruction::FPToSI:
975  case Instruction::SIToFP:
976  return createFPFUUnary(instr, op0, opCode);
977  }
978 
979  // fixes to match gcc: case where shifting by more than the number
980  // of bits in the number
981  // should probably ignore this case because it's undefined in the C
982  // standard.
983  if (isLogicalShift(instr)) {
984  RTLOp *truncate = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Rem);
985 
986  const Type *T = instr->getOperand(1)->getType();
987  unsigned size = T->getPrimitiveSizeInBits();
988 
989  truncate->setOperand(0, op1);
990  truncate->setOperand(1, rtl->addConst(utostr(size), size));
991 
992  op1 = truncate;
993  }
994 
995  if (op1Signed(instr)) {
996  RTLOp *sext = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::SExt);
997  //sext->setCastWidth(w);
998  RTLWidth w = op0->getWidth();
999  //if adding keyword $signed to an unsigned number, we need to create a temp
1000  //signal that pads the bitwidth with a 0, to make sure $signed doesn't accidentally
1001  //convert an unsigned number to a signed number
1002  if (!w.getSigned()
1003  && w.numBits(rtl, alloc) < w.numNativeBits(rtl, alloc)) {
1004  w = RTLWidth(w.numBits(rtl, alloc) + 1, w.numNativeBits(rtl, alloc),
1005  false);
1006  RTLSignal *op0_old = op0;
1007  op0 = rtl->addWire(verilogName(instr) + "_op0_temp", w);
1008  op0->connect(op0_old);
1009  }
1010  sext->setCastWidth(w);
1011  sext->setOperand(0, op0);
1012  op0 = sext;
1013  }
1014 
1015  if (op2Signed(instr)) {
1016  RTLOp *sext = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::SExt);
1017  //sext->setCastWidth(w);
1018  RTLWidth w = op1->getWidth();
1019  //if adding keyword $signed to an unsigned number, we need to create a temp
1020  //signal that pads the bitwidth with a 0, to make sure $signed doesn't accidentally
1021  //convert an unsigned number to a signed number
1022  if (!w.getSigned()
1023  && w.numBits(rtl, alloc) < w.numNativeBits(rtl, alloc)) {
1024  w = RTLWidth(w.numBits(rtl, alloc) + 1, w.numNativeBits(rtl, alloc),
1025  false);
1026  RTLSignal *op1_old = op1;
1027  op1 = rtl->addWire(verilogName(instr) + "_op1__temp", w);
1028  op1->connect(op1_old);
1029  }
1030  sext->setCastWidth(w);
1031  sext->setOperand(0, op1);
1032  op1 = sext;
1033  }
1034 
1035  RTLOp *FUop = rtl->addOp(instr);
1036  FUop->setOperand(0, op0);
1037  FUop->setOperand(1, op1);
1038  RTLWidth outWidth = RTLWidth(instr, MBW);
1039  FUop->setWidth(outWidth);
1040 
1041  RTLSignal *FUoutput = FUop;
1042 
1043 // FUop->setWidth(RTLWidth(MBW->getMinBitwidth(instr)));
1044 // FUop->setNativeWidth(RTLWidth(instr->getType()));
1045 // if(MBW->isSigned(instr)) FUop->setSigned(true);
1046 // if(MBW->bitwidthIsKnown(instr) && MBW->isSigned(instr)) FUop->getWidth().setSigned(true);
1047 // FUop->getWidth().setSigned(MBW->isSigned(instr));
1048 
1049  int latency = Scheduler::getNumInstructionCycles(instr);
1050  if (latency > 0 && !LEGUP_CONFIG->does_flow_support_multicycle_paths()) {
1051 
1052  // add flops for user specified set_operation_latency
1053  // this is for adders/subtractors/shifts - functional units without
1054  // lpm_* module instantiations
1055 
1056  RTLSignal *en = rtl->addWire(getEnableName(instr));
1057 
1058  RTLOp *enCond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ);
1059  enCond->setOperand(0, en);
1060  enCond->setOperand(1, ONE);
1061 
1062  // create shift register
1063  RTLSignal *prev_stage_reg = NULL;
1064  for (int i = 0; i < latency; i++) {
1065  RTLSignal *stage_reg = rtl->addReg(
1066  verilogName(instr) + "_stage" + utostr(i) + "_reg",
1067  outWidth);
1068  stage_reg->setCheckXs(false);
1069 
1070  RTLSignal *driver = prev_stage_reg;
1071  if (prev_stage_reg == NULL) {
1072  // first register is driven by FU wire
1073  driver = FUoutput;
1074  }
1075 
1076  stage_reg->addCondition(enCond, driver, instr);
1077 
1078  prev_stage_reg = stage_reg;
1079  }
1080  FUoutput = prev_stage_reg;
1081  }
1082 
1083  assert(FUoutput);
1084  return FUoutput;
1085 }
1086 
1087 void GenerateRTL::visitReturnInst(ReturnInst &I) {
1088  // don't print anything for void return
1089  if (I.getNumOperands() != 0) {
1090  RTLSignal *return_val = rtl->find("return_val");
1091  connectSignalToDriverInState(
1092  return_val, getOp(this->state, I.getOperand(0)), this->state, &I);
1093  }
1094 
1095  PropagatingSignals *ps = alloc->getPropagatingSignals();
1096  bool shouldConnectMemorySignals = ps->functionUsesMemory(Fp->getName());
1097 
1098  if (shouldConnectMemorySignals) {
1099  // finish = 1 when waitrequest == 0
1100  RTLOp *wait = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ);
1101  wait->setOperand(0, rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest"));
1102  wait->setOperand(1, ZERO);
1103  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->find("finish"), wait, this->state,
1104  &I);
1105  } else {
1106  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->find("finish"), ONE, this->state, &I);
1107  }
1108 }
1109 
1110 void GenerateRTL::visitUnreachableInst(UnreachableInst &I) {
1111 }
1112 
1113 std::string getPipelineLabel(const BasicBlock *BB) {
1114  const TerminatorInst *TI = BB->getTerminator();
1115  static std::map<std::string, int> numLabels;
1116  static std::map<const BasicBlock *, std::string> bbUniqueLabel;
1117  std::string label = getMetadataStr(TI, "legup.label");
1118  if (bbUniqueLabel.find(BB) == bbUniqueLabel.end()) {
1119  numLabels[label]++;
1120  bbUniqueLabel[BB] = label + "_" + utostr(numLabels[label]);
1121  }
1122  return bbUniqueLabel[BB];
1123 }
1124 
1125 Instruction *getInductionVar(BasicBlock *BB) {
1126  Instruction *inductionVar = NULL;
1127  for (BasicBlock::iterator I = BB->begin(), ie = BB->end(); I != ie; ++I) {
1128  if (getMetadataInt(I, "legup.canonical_induction")) {
1129  inductionVar = I;
1130  break;
1131  }
1132  }
1133  assert(inductionVar);
1134  return inductionVar;
1135 }
1136 
1137 RTLOp *GenerateRTL::getPipelineStateCondition(RTLSignal *signal,
1138  Instruction *instr,
1139  PIPELINE_STATE pipelineState) {
1140  bool PIPELINED = isPipelined(instr);
1141  std::string label = "";
1142  int II = 0;
1143 
1144  if (!PIPELINED)
1145  return 0;
1146 
1147  BasicBlock *BB = instr->getParent();
1148  Instruction *inductionVar = getInductionVar(BB);
1149  label = getPipelineLabel(BB);
1150  II = getPipelineII(BB);
1151 
1152  // induction variable signals are hard coded for now
1153  if (signal == rtl->find(verilogName(inductionVar) + "_reg")
1154  || instr == inductionVar) {
1155  return 0;
1156  }
1157 
1158  TerminatorInst *TI = BB->getTerminator();
1159  if (instr == TI->getOperand(0)) {
1160  signal->connect(rtl->find(label + "_pipeline_finish"));
1161  return 0;
1162  }
1163 
1164  int startTime = getMetadataInt(instr, "legup.pipeline.start_time");
1165  int timeAvail = getMetadataInt(instr, "legup.pipeline.avail_time");
1166  int expectedAvailTime = startTime
1167  + Scheduler::getNumInstructionCycles((Instruction*) instr);
1168 
1169  int time = timeAvail;
1170 
1171  if (pipelineState == INPUT_READY) {
1172  // load/store or floating point instructions take multiple cycles to
1173  // complete. Sometimes we want to connect the memory_controller_addr
1174  // and other signals to *start* the operation
1175  time = startTime;
1176  } else if (timeAvail != expectedAvailTime) {
1177  // this is caused when we have an operation, say an 'add' that
1178  // is normally chained in this scheduler. But since IMS doesn't
1179  // support chaining, the IMS schedules the add into the next
1180  // cycle.
1181  assert(timeAvail == expectedAvailTime + 1);
1182  time = expectedAvailTime;
1183  }
1184 
1185  RTLSignal *ii_state = rtl->find(label + "_ii_state");
1186 
1187  // connect the signal during the correct ii_state and valid_bit time
1188  RTLOp *cond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(
1189  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ)->setOperands(ii_state,
1190  new RTLConst(utostr(time % II), ii_state->getWidth())),
1191  rtl->find(label + "_valid_bit_" + utostr(time)));
1192  if (signal->isReg()) {
1193  //it it's a register, add the waitrequest condition to it
1194  RTLSignal *waitrequest = getWaitRequest(BB->getParent());
1195  RTLOp *regCond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(
1196  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Not)->setOperands(waitrequest), cond);
1197  return regCond;
1198  }
1199  return cond;
1200 }
1201 
1202 RTLOp *GenerateRTL::createOptoCheckState(State *state) {
1203 
1204  RTLOp *cond;
1205  cond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ);
1206  cond->setOperand(0, rtl->find("cur_state"));
1207  cond->setOperand(1, getStateSignal(state));
1208 
1209  return cond;
1210 }
1211 
1212 void GenerateRTL::connectSignalToDriverInState(RTLSignal *signal,
1213  RTLSignal *driver, State *state,
1214  Instruction *instr,
1215  PIPELINE_STATE pipelineState,
1216  bool setToDriverBits) {
1217 
1218  assert(state);
1219  assert(driver);
1220 
1221  RTLOp *cond;
1222 
1223  RTLOp *pipeline_cond =
1224  getPipelineStateCondition(signal, instr, pipelineState);
1225  if (isPipelined(instr) && pipeline_cond) {
1226  cond = pipeline_cond;
1227  } else {
1228  cond = createOptoCheckState(state);
1229  }
1230 
1231  signal->addCondition(cond, driver, instr, setToDriverBits);
1232 }
1233 
1234 // create signal which checks state AND another condition
1235 void GenerateRTL::connectSignalToDriverInStateWithCondition(
1236  RTLSignal *signal, RTLSignal *driver, State *state, RTLOp *newCond,
1237  Instruction *instr) {
1238 
1239  assert(state);
1240  assert(driver);
1241 
1242  RTLOp *stateCond = createOptoCheckState(state);
1243  ;
1244 
1245  RTLOp *cond;
1246  if (newCond) {
1247  cond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And);
1248  cond->setOperands(stateCond, newCond);
1249  } else {
1250  cond = stateCond;
1251  }
1252 
1253  signal->addCondition(cond, driver, instr);
1254 }
1255 
1256 void GenerateRTL::visitGetElementPtrInst(GetElementPtrInst &I) {
1257  // RAM pointer
1258 
1259  RTLSignal *gep = rtl->addWire(verilogName(&I),
1260  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1"));
1261 
1262  connectSignalToDriverInState(gep, getGEP(this->state, &I), this->state, &I);
1263 }
1264 
1265 int GenerateRTL::connectedToPortB(Instruction *instr) {
1266  if (!this->binding->existsBindingInstrFU(instr))
1267  return 0;
1268 
1269  std::string fuId = this->binding->getBindingInstrFU(instr);
1270  size_t found;
1271  found = fuId.find("mem_dual_port_0");
1272  if (found != string::npos) {
1273  return 0;
1274  } else {
1275  found = fuId.find("mem_dual_port_1");
1276  if (found != string::npos) {
1277  return 1;
1278  } else {
1279  errs() << "Error: mem_port not matched! FuId: " << fuId << "\n";
1280  return -1;
1281  }
1282  }
1283 }
1284 
1285 void GenerateRTL::visitLoadInst(LoadInst &I) {
1286  LoadInst *instr = &I;
1287  Value *addr = I.getPointerOperand();
1288 
1289  State *endState = fsm->getEndState(&I);
1290  assert(endState);
1291 
1292  RTLWidth w(instr->getType());
1293  //if the ranges aren't dynamic, then minimize loads as well. When dynamic ranges are specific
1294  //in a file, then comparators could be used to check the ranges coming from the loads, so they
1295  //shouldn't be minimized.
1296  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameter("MB_RANGE_FILE") == "")
1297  w = RTLWidth(instr, MBW);
1298  RTLSignal *loadWire = rtl->addWire(verilogName(instr), w);
1299 
1300  std::string regName = verilogName(instr) + "_reg";
1301  if (!rtl->exists(regName)) {
1302  RTLSignal *loadReg = rtl->addReg(regName, w);
1303  connectSignalToDriverInState(loadReg, loadWire, endState, instr,
1304  OUTPUT_READY);
1305  }
1306 
1307  assert(connectedToPortB(instr) != -1 && "FU doesn't match the mem port");
1308  std::string port = connectedToPortB(instr) ? "b" : "a";
1309 
1310  RAM *ram = NULL;
1311  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("LOCAL_RAMS")) {
1312  ram = alloc->getLocalRamFromValue(addr);
1313  }
1314 
1315  if (ram && alloc->isRAMLocaltoFct(Fp, ram)) {
1316  std::string name = ram->getName();
1317 
1318  //errs() << "Connecting local RAM: " << ram->getName() << "\n";
1319 
1320  // convert byte address to word address
1321  RTLOp *wordAddr = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Shr);
1322  wordAddr->setOperand(0, getOp(this->state, addr));
1323  int bytes = ram->getDataWidth() / 8;
1324  int ignore = (bytes == 0) ? 0 : (int) log2(bytes);
1325  wordAddr->setOperand(1, new RTLConst(utostr(ignore), RTLWidth(3)));
1326 
1327  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->find(name + "_address_" + port),
1328  wordAddr, this->state, instr);
1329  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->find(name + "_write_enable_" + port),
1330  ZERO, this->state, instr);
1331  connectSignalToDriverInState(loadWire, rtl->find(name + "_out_" + port),
1332  endState, instr);
1333  } else {
1334 
1335  loadStoreCommon(&I, addr);
1336  RTLSignal *memOut;
1337 
1338  // for parallel function
1339  // readdata needs to be taken from stored register
1340  bool isParallelFunction = Fp->hasFnAttribute("totalNumThreads");
1341  if (isParallelFunction) {
1342  memOut = rtl->find("memory_controller_out_stored_on_datavalid_" + port);
1343  } else {
1344  memOut = rtl->find("memory_controller_out_" + port);
1345  }
1346 
1347  RTLSignal *memWe = rtl->find("memory_controller_write_enable_" + port);
1348 
1349  connectSignalToDriverInState(memWe, ZERO, this->state, instr);
1350 
1351  // need to truncate memory_controller_out, which is usually
1352  // bigger than loadWire
1353  RTLOp *trunc = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Trunc);
1354  trunc->setCastWidth(loadWire->getWidth());
1355  trunc->setOperand(0, memOut);
1356  connectSignalToDriverInState(loadWire, trunc, endState, instr);
1357  }
1358 }
1359 
1360 void GenerateRTL::visitStoreInst(StoreInst &I) {
1361 
1362  Value *addr = I.getPointerOperand();
1363 
1364  assert(connectedToPortB(&I) != -1 && "FU doesn't match the mem port");
1365 
1366  std::string port = connectedToPortB(&I) ? "b" : "a";
1367 
1368  RAM *ram = NULL;
1369  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("LOCAL_RAMS")) {
1370 
1371  //NC changes...
1372  //TODO: DEBUGGING PROCEDURE IN THIS BLOCK NEEDS TO BE RE-THINKED
1373  ram = alloc->getLocalRamFromValue(addr);
1374  }
1375 
1376  if (ram && alloc->isRAMLocaltoFct(Fp, ram)) {
1377  std::string name = ram->getName();
1378 
1379  assert(!ram->isROM());
1380  // todo: refactor with visitLoadInst
1381  // convert byte address to word address
1382  RTLOp *wordAddr = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Shr);
1383  wordAddr->setOperand(0, getOp(this->state, addr));
1384  int bytes = ram->getDataWidth() / 8;
1385  int ignore = (bytes == 0) ? 0 : (int)log2(bytes);
1386  wordAddr->setOperand(1, new RTLConst(utostr(ignore), RTLWidth(3)));
1387 
1388  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->find(name + "_address_" + port),
1389  wordAddr, this->state, &I);
1390  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->find(name + "_write_enable_" + port),
1391  ONE, this->state, &I);
1392  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->find(name + "_in_" + port),
1393  getOp(this->state, I.getOperand(0)),
1394  this->state, &I);
1395 
1396  } else {
1397 
1398  loadStoreCommon(&I, addr);
1399  RTLSignal *memIn = rtl->find("memory_controller_in_" + port);
1400  RTLSignal *memWe = rtl->find("memory_controller_write_enable_" + port);
1401 
1402  connectSignalToDriverInState(memWe, ONE, this->state, &I);
1403 
1404  // zero extend the operand to be the same size as the
1405  // memory_controller_in
1406  RTLOp *ext = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::ZExt);
1407  ext->setCastWidth(memIn->getWidth());
1408  ext->setOperand(0, getOp(this->state, I.getOperand(0)));
1409  connectSignalToDriverInState(memIn, ext, this->state, &I);
1410 
1411  // NC changes
1412  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("INSPECT_DEBUG")) {
1413  int adrOffsetValue = 0;
1414  RTLSignal* adrSig = getOp(this->state, addr, adrOffsetValue);
1415  if (adrOffsetValue == 0)
1416  adrOffsetValue = -1;
1417 
1418  StateStoreInfo* storeInfo = new StateStoreInfo(this->state, port,
1419  adrSig, adrOffsetValue, &I);
1420  statesStoreMapping.push_back(storeInfo);
1421  }
1422  }
1423 }
1424 
1425 // size: 0 for bool/byte, 1 for short, 2 for word, 3 for long/other (struct, ptr, etc...)
1426 unsigned GenerateRTL::getInstrMemSize(Instruction *instr) {
1427  int bitwidth;
1428  if (isa<StoreInst>(*instr)) {
1429  bitwidth = instr->getOperand(0)->getType()->getPrimitiveSizeInBits();
1430  } else {
1431  bitwidth = instr->getType()->getPrimitiveSizeInBits();
1432  }
1433  if (bitwidth == 0) {
1434  // other ie. struct, pointer
1435  bitwidth = alloc->getDataLayout()->getPointerSize() * 8;
1436  }
1437 
1438  switch (bitwidth) {
1439  case 1:
1440  return 0;
1441  break; // bool
1442  case 8:
1443  return 0;
1444  break; // byte
1445  case 16:
1446  return 1;
1447  break; // short
1448  case 32:
1449  return 2;
1450  break; // word
1451  case 64:
1452  return 3;
1453  break; // long/other
1454  default:
1455  errs() << "Invalid bitwidth '" << bitwidth << "' for instr: " << *instr
1456  << "\n";
1457  return 0;
1458  }
1459 }
1460 
1461 void GenerateRTL::loadStoreCommon(Instruction *instr, Value *addr) {
1462 
1463  assert(isa<PointerType>(addr->getType()));
1464 
1465  assert(connectedToPortB(instr) != -1 && "FU doesn't match the mem port");
1466  std::string port = connectedToPortB(instr) ? "b" : "a";
1467 
1468  RTLSignal *memAddr = rtl->find("memory_controller_address_" + port);
1469  RTLSignal *memSize = rtl->find("memory_controller_size_" + port);
1470  RTLSignal *memEn = rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_" + port);
1471 
1472  connectSignalToDriverInState(memAddr, getOp(this->state, addr), this->state,
1473  instr);
1474  connectSignalToDriverInState(memEn, ONE, this->state, instr);
1475 
1476  if (alloc->usesGenericRAMs()) {
1477  unsigned size = getInstrMemSize(instr);
1478  connectSignalToDriverInState(memSize,
1479  rtl->addConst(utostr(size), RTLWidth(2)),
1480  this->state, instr);
1481  }
1482 }
1483 
1484 // ignore switch/branch/phi instructions
1485 // these are handled already by the FSM generated in scheduling
1486 void GenerateRTL::visitBranchInst(BranchInst &I) {
1487 }
1488 void GenerateRTL::visitSwitchInst(SwitchInst &I) {
1489 }
1490 
1491 void GenerateRTL::visitPHINode(PHINode &phi) {
1492 }
1493 
1494 // printf statements in C are replaced with $display() verilog statements for
1495 // modelsim simulation
1496 void GenerateRTL::visitPrintf(CallInst *CI, Function *called) {
1497  RTLOp *printf = NULL;
1498  if (called->getName() == "puts") {
1499  // puts expects a newline added
1500  printf = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Display);
1501  } else {
1502  // $write() is $display() but without the newline.
1503  printf = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Write);
1504  }
1505  Value *str = *CI->op_begin();
1506 
1507  // handle getelementptr
1508  if (const User *U = dyn_cast<User>(str)) {
1509  if (U->getNumOperands() > 1) {
1510  str = U->getOperand(0);
1511  }
1512  }
1513 
1514  GlobalVariable *G = dyn_cast<GlobalVariable>(str);
1515  if (!G) {
1516  outs() << "Cannot statically resolve char pointer for "
1517  << "printf call. Skipping verilog $display statement for:\n"
1518  << *CI << "\n";
1519  return;
1520  }
1521  assert(G);
1522  Constant *C = G->getInitializer();
1523 
1524  int index = 0;
1525  //errs() << "printf: " << *CA << "\n";
1526  //if (ConstantArray *CA = dyn_cast<ConstantArray>(C)) {
1527  if (ConstantDataArray *CA = dyn_cast<ConstantDataArray>(C)) {
1528  //errs() << "printf: " << *CA << "\n";
1529  // LLVM 3.4 update:
1530  //std::string s = "\"" + arrayToString(CA) + "\"";
1531  std::string st = CA->getAsString().str();
1532  st = st.substr(0, st.size() - 1);
1533  std::string s = "\"" + st + "\"";
1534 
1535  printf->setOperand(index, rtl->addConst(s));
1536  index++;
1537  }
1538 
1539  for (CallSite::arg_iterator AI = CI->op_begin() + 1, AE = CI->op_end() - 1;
1540  AI != AE; ++AI) {
1541  Value *arg = *AI;
1542  printf->setOperand(index, getOp(this->state, arg));
1543  index++;
1544  }
1545 
1546  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->getUnsynthesizableSignal(), printf,
1547  this->state, CI);
1548 }
1549 
1550 // this function is used to create function_memory_controller_out_port_instNum signal
1551 // used to connect parallel module "instantiations"
1552 // It creates a 2-bit shift register (for 2-cycle memory latency)
1553 // where the MSB is asserted in the cycle when the data comes back from memory
1554 // this needs to be stored in this cycle when sending it down to a parallel instance
1555 // before it is overwritten by readdata for another parallel instance
1556 // similar function, "createMemoryReaddataStorageForParallelFunction" used to create
1557 // storage "inside" the parallel module. Both functions are needed to get the correct
1558 // data from memory
1559 void GenerateRTL::createMemoryReaddataLogicForParallelInstance(RTLSignal *gnt,
1560  const std::string name, const std::string postfix, const std::string instanceNum) {
1561 
1562  // 2-bit shift register
1563  // data is "ready" (readdata has come back)
1564  // when dataReady1 is asserted
1565  RTLSignal *dataReady0, *dataReady1;
1566  dataReady0 = rtl->addReg(name + "_dataReady0" + postfix + instanceNum);
1567  dataReady1 = rtl->addReg(name + "_dataReady1" + postfix + instanceNum);
1568 
1569  // read and not write
1570  RTLSignal *memRead = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(
1571  rtl->find(name + "_enable" + postfix + instanceNum),
1572  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Not)->setOperands(
1573  rtl->find(name + "_write_enable" + postfix + instanceNum)));
1574  // read and granted
1575  RTLSignal *memReadGranted = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(gnt,
1576  memRead);
1577 
1578  RTLSignal *wait, *memoryControllerOut;
1579  // choose the correct memory controller signal depending on
1580  // whether this function uses Pthreads or not
1581  if (usesPthreads) {
1582  wait = rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest_arbiter");
1583  memoryControllerOut = rtl->find("memory_controller_out_arbiter" + postfix);
1584  } else {
1585  wait = rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest");
1586  memoryControllerOut = rtl->find("memory_controller_out" + postfix);
1587  }
1588 
1589  RTLSignal *reset;
1590  reset = rtl->find("reset");
1591  RTLOp *notWait = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Not)->setOperands(wait);
1592 
1593  // this signal is high one state after the read is granted
1594  dataReady0->addCondition(reset, ZERO);
1595  dataReady0->addCondition(notWait, memReadGranted);
1596 
1597  // this signal is high when the data read is ready to be stored
1598  dataReady1->addCondition(reset, ZERO);
1599  // for hybrid flow
1600  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->isHybridFlow()) {
1601  // it has to be a different for the hybrid flow
1602  // since the top level of the hybrid sends down readdata
1603  // two states after the read
1604  // hence this
1605  dataReady1->addCondition(notWait, dataReady0);
1606  } else {
1607  // for pure HW flow, the data is available on
1608  // the next clock edge after dataReady0
1609  dataReady1->connect(dataReady0);
1610  }
1611 
1612  // create the memory_controller_out signals to be connected
1613  // to a parallel instance
1614  RTLSignal *out = rtl->find(name + "_out" + postfix + instanceNum);
1615  RTLSignal *out_reg = rtl->addReg(name + "_out_reg" + postfix + instanceNum,
1616  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1"));
1617 
1618  // connect memory_controller_out when the data is ready
1619  // retain this data to avoid inferring a latch
1620  out->setDefaultDriver(out_reg);
1621  out->addCondition(
1622  dataReady1,
1623  memoryControllerOut);
1624 
1625  // register used to avoid inferring a latch
1626  // stores the readdata on posedge clk
1627  out_reg->addCondition(reset,
1628  rtl->addConst("0", RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1")));
1629  out_reg->addCondition(
1630  dataReady1,
1631  memoryControllerOut);
1632 }
1633 
1634 //create state1 and state2 to start/stop module instance and set state transitions
1635 void GenerateRTL::createStateTransitions(CallInst *CI, State *&state1,
1636  State *&state2, bool &isStateTerminating) {
1637 
1638  BasicBlock *bb = CI->getParent();
1639  assert(bb == this->state->getBasicBlock());
1640 
1641  FiniteStateMachine* fsm = sched->getFSM(Fp);
1642  state1 = fsm->newState(this->state, "LEGUP_function_call");
1643  stateSignals[state1] = rtl->addParam("state_placeholder", "placeholder");
1644  state1->setBasicBlock(bb);
1645  // state1->setFunctionCall(true);
1646 
1647  isStateTerminating = this->state->isTerminating();
1648  if (isStateTerminating) {
1649  state2 = fsm->newState(state1, "LEGUP_function_call");
1650  stateSignals[state2] = rtl->addParam("state_placeholder",
1651  "placeholder");
1652  state2->setBasicBlock(bb);
1653  state2->setTerminating(this->state->isTerminating());
1654 
1655  State::Transition origTransition = this->state->getTransition();
1656  state2->setTransition(origTransition);
1657  } else {
1658  // No need for an extra call state, just set it to the state's default transition
1659  state2 = this->state->getDefaultTransition();
1660  }
1661  this->state->setTerminating(false);
1662 
1663  // update FSM. CI will be removed from state when we return
1664  state1->push_back(CI);
1665  fsm->setStartState(CI, state1);
1666  fsm->setEndState(CI, state1);
1667 
1668  // need to clear all original transitions.
1669  // 'state' must have only 1 transition - because we must go to state1
1670  // where we'll wait for the call to complete.
1671  State::Transition blank;
1672  this->state->setTransition(blank);
1673  this->state->setDefaultTransition(state1);
1674  assert(this->state->getNumTransitions() == 1);
1675 
1676  state1->setDefaultTransition(state1);
1677 }
1678 
1679 void GenerateRTL::connectStartSignal(CallInst *CI, State *endState,
1680  const std::string moduleName,
1681  const std::string instanceName,
1682  RTLOp *oneCond, RTLOp *zeroCond) {
1683 
1684  RTLSignal *startReg = rtl->addReg(moduleName + "_start" + instanceName);
1685 
1686  // connect one in the call state
1687  connectSignalToDriverInStateWithCondition(startReg, ONE, this->state,
1688  oneCond, CI);
1689 
1690  // connect zero in the next state
1691  connectSignalToDriverInStateWithCondition(startReg, ZERO, endState,
1692  zeroCond);
1693 }
1694 
1695 int GenerateRTL::getNumThreads(const CallInst *CI) {
1696 
1697  int numThreads = getMetadataInt(CI, "NUMTHREADS");
1698  // if it's a OpenMP wrapper function,
1699  // don't create multiple instances
1700  std::string functionType = getMetadataStr(CI, "TYPE");
1701  if (functionType == "legup_wrapper_omp") {
1702  numThreads = 0;
1703  }
1704 
1705  return numThreads;
1706 }
1707 
1708 // given a call inst, get its metadata
1709 // to determine the instance number
1710 int GenerateRTL::getInstanceNum(const CallInst *CI, const int loopIndex) {
1711 
1712  int instanceNum;
1713  const int numThreads = getMetadataInt(CI, "NUMTHREADS");
1714 
1715  // if the loop is unrolled
1716  if (numThreads == 1) {
1717  instanceNum = getMetadataInt(CI, "THREADID");
1718  } else {
1719  instanceNum = loopIndex;
1720  }
1721 
1722  return instanceNum;
1723 }
1724 
1725 // prepend "_inst" to instanceNum
1726 std::string GenerateRTL::getInstanceName(const CallInst *CI,
1727  const int loopIndex) {
1728 
1729  std::string functionType = getMetadataStr(CI, "TYPE");
1730  // if this a call to a parallel function
1731  // if (getMetadataInt(CI, "NUMTHREADS") && functionType !=
1732  // "legup_wrapper_omp")
1733  if (getNumThreads(CI))
1734  return "_inst" + utostr(getInstanceNum(CI, loopIndex));
1735  else
1736  return "";
1737 }
1738 
1739 RTLOp *GenerateRTL::getOpToCheckThreadID(RTLSignal *threadIDSignal,
1740  const int threadIDValue) {
1741 
1742  RTLOp *checkthreadID = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ)->setOperands(
1743  threadIDSignal,
1744  rtl->addConst(utostr(threadIDValue), threadIDSignal->getWidth()));
1745 
1746  return checkthreadID;
1747 }
1748 
1749 // create and connect start signal for module instance
1750 void GenerateRTL::createStartSignal(CallInst *CI, State *state1,
1751  const std::string moduleName,
1752  const int numThreads,
1753  const std::string functionType) {
1754 
1755  RTLSignal *wait;
1756  // get the waitrequest signal
1757  if (functionType == "legup_wrapper_pthreadcall") {
1758  wait = rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest_arbiter");
1759  } else {
1760  wait = rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest");
1761  }
1762 
1763  RTLOp *noWait = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ)->setOperands(wait, ZERO);
1764 
1765  // setting up the start signal
1766  if (numThreads > 0) {
1767  // if there are parallel functions,
1768  // connect the start signal to all parallel instances
1769  for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++) {
1770  RTLOp *checkthreadID = 0;
1771  // for pthread_create, create Op to check threadID
1772  if (functionType == "legup_wrapper_pthreadcall") {
1773  RTLSignal *threadIDValue = getPthreadThreadID(CI, moduleName);
1774  checkthreadID =
1775  getOpToCheckThreadID(threadIDValue, getInstanceNum(CI, i));
1776  }
1777  connectStartSignal(CI, state1, moduleName, getInstanceName(CI, i),
1778  checkthreadID, noWait);
1779  }
1780  } else {
1781  // if sequential function,
1782  // just connect it to the one instance
1783  connectStartSignal(CI, state1, moduleName, getInstanceName(CI));
1784  }
1785 }
1786 
1787 // create and connect argument signals to module instance
1788 void GenerateRTL::createArgumentSignals(CallInst *CI, Function *called,
1789  const std::string moduleName,
1790  const int numThreads,
1791  const std::string functionType) {
1792 
1793  RTLSignal *argSignal;
1794 
1795  // iterate through each argument
1796  CallSite::arg_iterator AI = CI->op_begin(), AE = CI->op_end() - 1;
1797  for (Function::arg_iterator FI = called->arg_begin(),
1798  Fe = called->arg_end();
1799  FI != Fe; ++FI) {
1800  assert(AI != AE);
1801  Value *arg = *AI;
1802  assert(arg);
1803 
1804  std::string name = moduleName + "_"
1805  + alloc->verilogNameFunction(FI, called);
1806  RTLWidth w(arg, MBW);
1807 
1808  // adjust width of arguments for bitcast cases
1809  // ie. %2 = call i8* bitcast (void (i32*, i32, i32)* @legup_memset_4 to
1810  // i8* (i8*, i8, i64)*)(i8* %1, i8 0, i64 40)
1811  multi_cycle_set_force_wire_operand(true); // Temporary solution...
1812  RTLSignal *argDriver = getOp(this->state, arg);
1813  multi_cycle_set_force_wire_operand(false);
1814  argDriver->setWidth(w);
1815 
1816  if (numThreads > 0) {
1817  // if there are parallel functions,
1818  // connect signal to all parallel instances
1819  for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++) {
1820  RTLOp *checkthreadID = 0;
1821  argSignal = rtl->addReg(name + getInstanceName(CI, i), w);
1822  // for pthread_create, create Op to check threadID
1823  if (functionType == "legup_wrapper_pthreadcall") {
1824  RTLSignal *threadIDValue =
1825  rtl->find(moduleName + "_threadID");
1826  checkthreadID = getOpToCheckThreadID(threadIDValue,
1827  getInstanceNum(CI, i));
1828  }
1829  connectSignalToDriverInStateWithCondition(
1830  argSignal, argDriver, this->state, checkthreadID, CI);
1831  }
1832  } else {
1833  // if sequential function,
1834  // just connect it to the one instance
1835  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->addReg(name, w), argDriver,
1836  this->state, CI);
1837  }
1838  ++AI;
1839  }
1840 }
1841 
1842 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getPthreadThreadID(CallInst *CI,
1843  const std::string moduleName) {
1844 
1845  // get the threadID which is an operand of the store instruction
1846  // right before the call to the pthread function
1847  Value *threadIDValueArg;
1848  Instruction *threadID = CI->getPrevNode();
1849  if (StoreInst *st = dyn_cast<StoreInst>(threadID)) {
1850  if (getMetadataInt(threadID, "legup_pthread_functionthreadID")) {
1851  // get the value operand of the store instruction
1852  threadIDValueArg = st->getValueOperand();
1853  } else {
1854  assert (0 && "The Pthread function threadID cannot be found\n");
1855  }
1856  } else {
1857  assert (0 && "The store instruction after the call to pthread function cannot be found\n");
1858  }
1859  assert(threadIDValueArg);
1860 
1861  // get bottom 16 bits of the value being stored
1862  // this is the threadID
1863  RTLSignal *threadIDValue = rtl->addWire(moduleName + "_threadID", RTLWidth(16));
1864  RTLOp *trunc_op = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Trunc);
1865  //set the cast width to the bottom 16 bits
1866  trunc_op->setCastWidth(RTLWidth("15", "0"));
1867  // get the bottom 16 bits of threadVar signal
1868  trunc_op->setOperand(0, getOpReg(threadIDValueArg, this->state));
1869 
1870  connectSignalToDriverInState(threadIDValue, trunc_op, this->state, CI);
1871 
1872  return threadIDValue;
1873 }
1874 
1875 void GenerateRTL::connectReturnSignal(State *callState, CallInst *CI,
1876  Function *calledFunction,
1877  const std::string moduleName,
1878  const int numThreads,
1879  const int loopIndex) {
1880 
1881  const Type *rT = calledFunction->getReturnType();
1882  RTLWidth T(rT);
1883 
1884  RTLOp *resetCond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)->setOperands(
1885  rtl->find("reset"),
1886  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ)
1887  ->setOperands(rtl->find("cur_state"), stateSignals[this->state]));
1888 
1889  RTLSignal *ret = rtl->addWire(
1890  moduleName + "_return_val" + getInstanceName(CI, loopIndex), T);
1891 
1892  RTLSignal *retReg = rtl->addReg(moduleName + "_return_val" +
1893  getInstanceName(CI, loopIndex) + "_reg",
1894  T);
1895  retReg->addCondition(resetCond, rtl->addConst("0", T));
1896 
1897  RTLSignal *finish =
1898  rtl->find(moduleName + "_finish" + getInstanceName(CI, loopIndex));
1899  retReg->addCondition(finish, ret);
1900 
1901  if (!numThreads)
1902  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->addWire(verilogName(CI), T), retReg,
1903  callState, CI);
1904 }
1905 
1906 // create return signal for module instance
1907 void GenerateRTL::createReturnSignal(State *callState, CallInst *CI,
1908  Function *called,
1909  const std::string moduleName,
1910  const int numThreads,
1911  const std::string functionType) {
1912 
1913  std::string instanceNum;
1914  // setting up return value
1915  const Type *rT = called->getReturnType();
1916 
1917  if (rT->getTypeID() != Type::VoidTyID) {
1918  if (numThreads > 0) {
1919  if (functionType == "legup_wrapper_pthreadpoll") {
1920  RTLWidth T(rT);
1921  RTLSignal *ret = rtl->addWire(moduleName + "_return_val", T);
1922  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->addWire(verilogName(CI), T),
1923  ret, callState, CI);
1924  } else {
1925  // if there are parallel functions,
1926  // connect the return signal to all parallel instances
1927  for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++) {
1928 
1929  connectReturnSignal(callState, CI, called, moduleName,
1930  numThreads, i);
1931  }
1932  }
1933  } else {
1934  // if sequential function,
1935  // just connect it to the one instance
1936  connectReturnSignal(callState, CI, called, moduleName, numThreads);
1937  }
1938  }
1939 }
1940 
1941 void GenerateRTL::connectFinishSignal(CallInst *CI, RTLSignal *finish_final,
1942  const std::string moduleName,
1943  const std::string functionType,
1944  const int numThreads,
1945  std::vector<RTLSignal *> &finishVector,
1946  const int loopIndex) {
1947 
1948  std::string finishName = moduleName + "_finish";
1949  std::string instanceName = getInstanceName(CI, loopIndex);
1950 
1951  // adding finish signal for each instance
1952  RTLSignal *instanceFinishReg =
1953  rtl->addReg(finishName + instanceName + "_reg");
1954  RTLSignal *finish_inst = rtl->addWire(finishName + instanceName);
1955 
1956  RTLOp *resetCond;
1957  // To clear finish_reg signal for each instance
1958  if (functionType == "legup_wrapper_pthreadcall") {
1959  // for pthreads, since the calls are non-blocking
1960  // we need to clear it after it has been detected by pthread_join
1961  // so it's safe to clear it whenever each instance is started
1962  RTLSignal *start_inst = rtl->find(moduleName + "_start" + instanceName);
1963  resetCond =
1964  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)->setOperands(rtl->find("reset"), start_inst);
1965  } else {
1966  // otherwise, for sequential and OpenMP functions
1967  // calls are blocking, hence reset in the
1968  // state before the call state
1969  resetCond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)->setOperands(
1970  rtl->find("reset"),
1971  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ)->setOperands(rtl->find("cur_state"),
1972  stateSignals[this->state]));
1973  }
1974 
1975  // if (resetCond)
1976  // finishName_reg_inst <= 0;
1977  instanceFinishReg->addCondition(resetCond, ZERO);
1978 
1979  // if (finishName_inst)
1980  // finishName_reg_inst <= 1'b1;
1981  instanceFinishReg->addCondition(finish_inst, ONE);
1982 
1983  // for OpenMP, you need to AND all finish signal together
1984  // push all signals into a vector
1985  if (functionType == "omp_function") {
1986  finishVector.push_back(instanceFinishReg);
1987 
1988  // if in last iteration of loop
1989  if (getInstanceNum(CI, loopIndex) == numThreads - 1) {
1990  // now AND the finish signals together
1991  RTLOp *op_and =
1992  rtl->recursivelyAddOp(RTLOp::And, finishVector, numThreads);
1993  finish_final->connect(op_and);
1994  }
1995  } else {
1996  assert(instanceFinishReg);
1997  finish_final->connect(instanceFinishReg);
1998  }
1999 }
2000 
2001 void GenerateRTL::createFinishSignal(CallInst *CI, State *callState,
2002  State *callEndState,
2003  const std::string moduleName,
2004  const int numThreads,
2005  const std::string functionType) {
2006 
2007  // create finish signal
2008  std::string finishName_final = moduleName + "_finish_final";
2009  RTLSignal *finish_final = rtl->addWire(finishName_final);
2010 
2011  // set the transition from callState to callEndState
2012  if (functionType == "legup_wrapper_pthreadcall") {
2013  // for pthread functions, just move onto next state
2014  // without checking the finish signal
2015  // since it's non-blocking
2016  callState->setDefaultTransition(callEndState);
2017  } else {
2018  // if not pthreads, check the finish signal to move to next state
2019  callState->setTransitionSignal(finish_final);
2020  callState->addTransition(callEndState);
2021  }
2022 
2023  // finish signal for pthread poll is create later
2024  if (functionType != "legup_wrapper_pthreadpoll") {
2025  vector<RTLSignal *> finishVector;
2026  if (numThreads > 0) {
2027  // for parallel functions, the finish signal from each instance
2028  // needs to be registered
2029  for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++) {
2030  connectFinishSignal(CI, finish_final, moduleName, functionType,
2031  numThreads, finishVector, i);
2032  }
2033  } else {
2034  // you need to register the finish signal
2035  // since if there is memory access to shared memory space in the
2036  // very last state a function
2037  // the finish signal goes may go high then low while the waitrequest
2038  // is asserted
2039  // in which case the calling function's FSM will be able to move
2040  // onto the next state due to the waitrequest
2041  connectFinishSignal(CI, finish_final, moduleName, functionType,
2042  numThreads, finishVector);
2043  }
2044  }
2045 }
2046 
2047 void GenerateRTL::connectWaitrequestForParallelFunctions(
2048  CallInst *CI, State *callState, const std::string name,
2049  const std::string funcName, const std::string functionType,
2050  const int loopIndex) {
2051 
2052  std::string instanceName = getInstanceName(CI, loopIndex);
2053 
2054  RTLSignal *wait, *wait_local, *gnt, *gnt_reg, *gntNotGiven, *waitDriver;
2055  RTLOp *avalonStall;
2056 
2057  // waitrequest is asserted when
2058  // 1. this instance is accessing shared memory space and Avalon waitrequest
2059  // is asserted
2060  // 2. enable is asserted but gnt is not given
2061  wait_local = rtl->addWire(name + "_waitrequest" + instanceName);
2062  if (usesPthreads) {
2063  wait = rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest_arbiter");
2064  } else {
2065  wait = rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest");
2066  }
2067  RTLOp *notWait_local = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Not)->setOperands(wait_local);
2068 
2069  int instanceIndex = getInstanceNum(CI, loopIndex);
2070  gnt =
2071  rtl->find(funcName + "_memory_controller_gnt_" + utostr(instanceIndex));
2072  gnt_reg = rtl->addReg(funcName + "_memory_controller_gnt_" +
2073  utostr(instanceIndex) + "_reg");
2074 
2075  RTLSignal *en_a = rtl->find(name + "_enable_a" + instanceName);
2076  RTLSignal *en_b = rtl->find(name + "_enable_b" + instanceName);
2077  RTLSignal *notGnt = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Not)->setOperands(gnt);
2078  RTLSignal *memAccess = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)->setOperands(en_a, en_b);
2079  gntNotGiven = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(memAccess, notGnt);
2080 
2081  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->isHybridFlow()) {
2082  // in hybrid case, waitrequest is asserted when
2083  // there is a memory request but the grant is not given at the current
2084  // level
2085  // or when there is an waitrequest over avalon from parent module
2086  // for avalon waitrequest, grant is registered since Avalon memory
2087  // accesses
2088  // are pipelined, hence the avalon waitrequest comes one state after
2089  // memory request from current level
2090  gnt_reg->addCondition(notWait_local, gnt);
2091  avalonStall = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(wait, gnt_reg);
2092  waitDriver =
2093  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)->setOperands(gntNotGiven, avalonStall);
2094  } else {
2095  // pure HW case, waitrequest is asserted when
2096  // there is a memory request but the grant is not given at the current
2097  // level
2098  // or when the grant is given but wait request is asserted from the
2099  // parent module
2100  // (this happens when the grant is not given from the parent module)
2101  waitDriver = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)->setOperands(
2102  gntNotGiven, rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(gnt, wait));
2103  }
2104 
2105  assert(waitDriver);
2106  // connect waitrequest signal
2107  if (functionType == "legup_wrapper_pthreadcall") {
2108  // can't check the state for pthreads case
2109  // as the FSM will be moving to execute other things with the
2110  // pthread instances running in parallel
2111  wait_local->connect(waitDriver);
2112  } else {
2113  connectSignalToDriverInState(wait_local, waitDriver, callState, CI);
2114  }
2115 }
2116 
2117 void GenerateRTL::createWaitrequestLogic(CallInst *CI, State *callState,
2118  std::string name, const int numThreads,
2119  const std::string functionType) {
2120 
2121  std::string funcName;
2122  Function *called = CI->getCalledFunction();
2123  if (!called) {
2124  // indirect call, for example:
2125  // tail call void bitcast (i32 (...)* @exit to void (i32)*)(i32 1)
2126  // noreturn nounwind
2127  Value *Callee = CI->getCalledValue();
2128  if (ConstantExpr *CE = dyn_cast<ConstantExpr>(Callee)) {
2129  if (Function *RF = dyn_cast<Function>(CE->getOperand(0))) {
2130  funcName = RF->getName();
2131  }
2132  }
2133  } else {
2134  funcName = called->getName();
2135  }
2136 
2137  PropagatingSignals *ps = alloc->getPropagatingSignals();
2138  bool shouldConnectMemorySignals = ps->functionUsesMemory(funcName)
2139  || usesPthreads;
2140 
2141  stripInvalidCharacters(funcName);
2142 
2143  // setting up the waitrequest signal
2144  if (numThreads > 0) {
2145  for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++) {
2146 
2147  connectWaitrequestForParallelFunctions(CI, callState, name,
2148  funcName, functionType, i);
2149  }
2150  } else if (shouldConnectMemorySignals) {
2151  RTLSignal *wait_local = rtl->addWire(name + "_waitrequest");
2152  // connectSignalToDriverInState(wait_local,
2153  // rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest"), callState, CI);
2154  wait_local->connect(rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest"));
2155  }
2156 }
2157 
2158 // connect pthreadID and functionID signals to operand
2159 // based on state
2160 void GenerateRTL::connectPthreadIDSignals(CallInst *CI, RTLSignal *pollThreadID,
2161  RTLSignal *pollFunctionID) {
2162 
2163  // get the state in which the wrapper is called
2164  State *callState = fsm->getEndState(CI);
2165 
2166  // get the thread variable from the call instruction
2167  Value *threadVar = CI->getArgOperand(0);
2168  assert(threadVar);
2169 
2170  // get and connect threadID signal from the bottom half
2171  // of thread variable
2172  RTLOp *op = selectTopOrBottomHalfBits(threadVar, callState, false);
2173  connectSignalToDriverInState(pollThreadID, op, callState, CI);
2174 
2175  // get and connect functionID signal from the top half
2176  // of thread variable
2177  RTLOp *op2 = selectTopOrBottomHalfBits(threadVar, callState, true);
2178  connectSignalToDriverInState(pollFunctionID, op2, callState, CI);
2179 }
2180 
2181 RTLOp *GenerateRTL::selectTopOrBottomHalfBits(Value *V, State *state,
2182  bool top) {
2183 
2184  // get the RTLSignal for that value
2185  RTLSignal *signal = getOpReg(V, state);
2186 
2187  RTLOp *op;
2188  RTLConst *constant;
2189 
2190  // if V is a constant int
2191  if (dyn_cast<ConstantInt>(V)) {
2192  if (top) {
2193  // if you want the top half, then
2194  // right shift by half the bitwidth
2195  op = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Shr);
2196  constant = rtl->addConst(utostr(16), RTLWidth("4", "0"));
2197  } else {
2198  // if you want the bottom half, then
2199  // AND with FFFF
2200  op = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And);
2201  constant = rtl->addConst(utostr(0xFFFF), RTLWidth("15", "0"));
2202  }
2203  op->setOperands(signal, constant);
2204  } else {
2205  // else if it's a signal
2206  // then select the correct width
2207  op = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Trunc);
2208  if (top) {
2209  op->setCastWidth(RTLWidth("31", "16"));
2210  } else {
2211  op->setCastWidth(RTLWidth("15", "0"));
2212  }
2213  op->setOperand(0, signal);
2214  }
2215 
2216  return op;
2217 }
2218 
2219 void GenerateRTL::connectPthreadPollFinishAndReturnVal(
2220  CallInst *CI, RTLSignal *pollThreadID, RTLSignal *pollFunctionID) {
2221 
2222  /*
2223  we want to make the following signals for finish
2224  when there are two functions, A & B, each with two threads,
2225  legup_pthreadpoll_finish = 0;
2226  if (legup_pthreadpoll_threadID == 0 && legup_pthreadpoll_functionID == 0 &&
2227  legup_pthreadcall_A_finish_final0 == 1)
2228  legup_pthreadpoll_finish = 1;
2229  if (legup_pthreadpoll_threadID == 1 && legup_pthreadpoll_functionID == 0 &&
2230  legup_pthreadcall_A_finish_final1 == 1)
2231  legup_pthreadpoll_finish = 1;
2232  if (legup_pthreadpoll_threadID == 0 && legup_pthreadpoll_functionID == 1 &&
2233  legup_pthreadcall_B_finish_final0 == 1)
2234  legup_pthreadpoll_finish = 1;
2235  if (legup_pthreadpoll_threadID == 1 && legup_pthreadpoll_functionID == 1 &&
2236  legup_pthreadcall_B_finish_final1 == 1)
2237  legup_pthreadpoll_finish = 1;
2238 
2239  also make the following signals for return_val
2240  when there are two functions, A & B, each with two threads,
2241  legup_pthreadpoll_return_val = 0;
2242  if (legup_pthreadpoll_threadID == 0 && legup_pthreadpoll_functionID == 0 &&
2243  legup_pthreadcall_A_finish_final0 == 1)
2244  legup_pthreadpoll_return_val = legup_pthreadcall_A_return_val_inst0;
2245  if (legup_pthreadpoll_threadID == 1 && legup_pthreadpoll_functionID == 0 &&
2246  legup_pthreadcall_A_finish_final1 == 1)
2247  legup_pthreadpoll_return_val = legup_pthreadcall_A_return_val_inst1;
2248  if (legup_pthreadpoll_threadID == 0 && legup_pthreadpoll_functionID == 1 &&
2249  legup_pthreadcall_B_finish_final0 == 1)
2250  legup_pthreadpoll_return_val = legup_pthreadcall_B_return_val_inst0;
2251  if (legup_pthreadpoll_threadID == 1 && legup_pthreadpoll_functionID == 1 &&
2252  legup_pthreadcall_B_finish_final1 == 1)
2253  legup_pthreadpoll_return_val = legup_pthreadcall_B_return_val_inst1;
2254  */
2255 
2256  // get the name of the pthread function
2257  std::string pthreadFuncName = CI->getCalledFunction()->getName();
2258 
2259  // get the number of threads for that pthread function
2260  int numThreads = getNumThreads(CI);
2261 
2262  // find the finish signal for pthread polling wrapper
2263  RTLSignal *finish = rtl->addWire("legup_pthreadpoll_finish_final");
2264  finish->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
2265 
2266  // iterate through each thread of the pthread function
2267  for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++) {
2268 
2269  std::string instNum = utostr(getInstanceNum(CI, i));
2270 
2271  // find the finish signal from pthread calling wrapper
2272  RTLSignal *pthreadCallFinish =
2273  rtl->addWire(pthreadFuncName + "_finish_inst" + instNum + "_reg");
2274 
2275  // if (legup_pthreadpoll_threadID == 0 &&
2276  // legup_pthreadcall_A_finish_final0 == 1)
2277  // legup_pthreadpoll_finish = 1;
2278  RTLSignal *finishCond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(
2279  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ)->setOperands(
2280  pollThreadID, rtl->addConst(instNum, RTLWidth(16))),
2281  pthreadCallFinish);
2282 
2283  // if there is more than one function in the pthread polling wrapper
2284  // need to check the functionID as well
2285  // if (legup_pthreadpoll_functionID == 0 && legup_pthreadpoll_threadID
2286  // == 0 && legup_pthreadcall_A_finish_final0 == 1)
2287  // legup_pthreadpoll_finish = 1;
2288  //
2289  // get the functionID for this pthread function
2290  int functionID = getMetadataInt(CI, "FUNCTIONID");
2291  RTLSignal *functionIDCond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ)->setOperands(
2292  pollFunctionID, rtl->addConst(utostr(functionID), RTLWidth(16)));
2293 
2294  RTLSignal *finishCond_final =
2295  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(finishCond, functionIDCond);
2296 
2297  finish->addCondition(finishCond_final, ONE);
2298 
2299  // if there are any non-void pthead functions
2300  // connect the return value signal
2301  if (!CI->getCalledFunction()->getReturnType()->isVoidTy()) {
2302  const Type *rT =
2303  PointerType::get(IntegerType::get(CI->getContext(), 8), 0);
2304  // make the return val signal
2305  RTLSignal *pthreadReturnVal =
2306  rtl->addWire("legup_pthreadpoll_return_val", RTLWidth(rT));
2307  // set default to 0
2308  pthreadReturnVal->setDefaultDriver(
2309  rtl->addConst(utostr(0), RTLWidth(rT)));
2310  // add register for return val
2311  RTLSignal *pthreadReturnVal_reg = rtl->addWire(
2312  pthreadFuncName + "_return_val_inst" + instNum + "_reg",
2313  RTLWidth(rT));
2314  // connect register if instance is finished
