4413  std::map<unsigned, Node*> Graph2_Labels;
4414  for (Graph::GraphNodes_iterator GNi = g2->GraphNodes.begin(), GNe =
4415  g2->GraphNodes.end(); GNi != GNe; ++GNi) {
4416  int label = GNi->second->label;
4417  // now we can map an int (label) to a node in graph2, and since we
4418  // have also labelled all nodes in graph1 the same way, we can map
4419  // graph1 nodes to graph2
4420  Graph2_Labels[label] = GNi->second;
4421 
4422  connectPatternFU(GNi, PairNumber);
4423  }
4424 
4425  // Now, every FU in graph 1 has a unique name. Next, create each FU and
4426  // connect them properly to make the hardware chain
4427  // Once each FU is made from the nodes in graph1, the corresponding
4428  // node in graph2 will be bound to that same functional unit
4429 
4430  // Iterate over all nodes in the graph again, but for which we now have
4431  // a unique name
4432  for (std::map<Node*, std::string>::iterator FUi = FUNames.begin(), FUe =
4433  FUNames.end(); FUi != FUe; ++FUi) {
4434  // the name of this FU (from part 1 above)
4435  std::string name1 = FUi->second;
4436  // the node in graph 1 corresponding to this FU
4437  Node * node1 = FUi->first;
4438  // equivalent node in graph 2
4439  Node *node2 = Graph2_Labels[node1->label];
4440 
4441  create_pattern_fu(name1, node1, node2);
4442  }
4443 
4444  PairNumber++;
4445  }
4446 
4447 }
4448 
4449 // This function is responsible for two things which are necessary to perform
4450 // Binding with graph objects:
4451 //
4452 // 1. Creating a set of properly connected functional units for each pair
4453 // 2. For two graphs which are bound together, mapping the equivalent
4454 // instructions in both graphs to the same functional units
4455 //
4456 // Note that all graphs which need to be paired are already contained in the
4457 // map GraphPairs (mapping graph g1 to graph g2 if g1 and g2 need to be paired)
4458 
4459 void GenerateRTL::updateRTLWithPatterns() {
4460 
4461  create_functional_units_for_pairs();
4462 
4463  // all instructions from the first graph are driven by their equivalent
4464  // instructions from the second graph
4465  for (std::map<Value*, Value*>::iterator i =
4466  this->AllBindingPairs.begin(), e = this->AllBindingPairs.end();
4467  i != e; ++i) {
4468 
4469  std::string firstName = verilogName(i->first);
4470  std::string secondName = verilogName(i->second);
4471 
4472  if (rtl->exists(secondName + "_reg")) {
4473  connectSignalToDriverInState(
4474  rtl->find(secondName + "_reg"), rtl->find(firstName),
4475  fsm->getEndState((Instruction *)(i->first)),
4476  (Instruction *)(i->first));
4477  }
4478 
4479  RTLSignal *first = rtl->findExists(firstName);
4480  RTLSignal *second = rtl->findExists(secondName);
4481  if (first && second) {
4482  first->connect(second, (Instruction*) (i->first));
4483  if (second->getWidth().numBits(rtl, alloc)
4484  < first->getWidth().numBits(rtl, alloc)) {
4485  second->setWidth(first->getWidth());
4486  }
4487  }
4488 
4489  first = rtl->findExists(firstName + "_reg");
4490  second = rtl->findExists(secondName + "_reg");
4491  if (first && second) {
4492  // this signal shares a register with the second graph
4493  first->setType("wire");
4494  first->connect(second, (Instruction*) (i->first));
4495  if (second->getWidth().numBits(rtl, alloc)
4496  < first->getWidth().numBits(rtl, alloc)) {
4497  second->setWidth(first->getWidth());
4498  }
4499  }
4500  }
4501 }
4502 
4503 std::vector<PropagatingSignal> GenerateRTL::addPropagatingMemorySignalsToModuleWithPostfix(
4504  RTLModule *_rtl, std::string postfix) {
4505 
4506  std::vector<RTLSignal *> signals;
4507  std::vector<PropagatingSignal> propSignals;
4508 
4509  signals.push_back(_rtl->addOut("memory_controller_enable" + postfix));
4510  signals.push_back(
4511  _rtl->addOut("memory_controller_address" + postfix,
4512  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1")));
4513  signals.push_back(_rtl->addOut("memory_controller_write_enable" + postfix));
4514  signals.push_back(
4515  _rtl->addOut("memory_controller_in" + postfix,
4516  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1")));
4517 
4518  if (alloc->usesGenericRAMs()) {
4519  signals.push_back(
4520  _rtl->addOut("memory_controller_size" + postfix, RTLWidth(2)));
4521  }
4522  signals.push_back(
4523  _rtl->addIn("memory_controller_out" + postfix,
4524  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1")));
4525 
4526  for (std::vector<RTLSignal *>::iterator it = signals.begin();
4527  it != signals.end(); ++it) {
4528 
4529  if ((*it)->getType() == "output") {
4530  (*it)->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
4531  connectSignalToDriverInState(*it, ZERO, sched->getFSM(Fp)->begin());
4532  }
4533 
4534  // Create a propagating signal wrapper that points to *it,
4535  // stops at the top level module, and is marked as a memory
4536  // signal.
4537  PropagatingSignal propSignal(*it, true, true);
4538  propSignals.push_back(propSignal);
4539 
4540  }
4541 
4542  return propSignals;
4543 
4544 }
4545 
4546 std::vector<PropagatingSignal> GenerateRTL::addPropagatingMemorySignalsToFunctionWithPostfix(
4547  Function *F, std::string postfix) {
4548 
4549  std::vector<RTLSignal *> signals;
4550  std::vector<PropagatingSignal> propSignals;
4551 
4552  signals.push_back(new RTLSignal("memory_controller_enable" + postfix, ""));
4553  signals.push_back(
4554  new RTLSignal("memory_controller_address" + postfix, "",
4555  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1")));
4556  signals.push_back(
4557  new RTLSignal("memory_controller_write_enable" + postfix, ""));
4558  signals.push_back(
4559  new RTLSignal("memory_controller_in" + postfix, "",
4560  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1")));
4561 
4562  if (alloc->usesGenericRAMs()) {
4563  signals.push_back(
4564  new RTLSignal("memory_controller_size" + postfix, "",
4565  RTLWidth(2)));
4566  }
4567  for (std::vector<RTLSignal *>::iterator it = signals.begin();
4568  it != signals.end(); ++it) {
4569 
4570  (*it)->setType("output");
4571 
4572  }
4573 
4574  RTLSignal *controllerOut = new RTLSignal("memory_controller_out" + postfix,
4575  "", RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1"));
4576  controllerOut->setType("input");
4577  signals.push_back(controllerOut);
4578 
4579  for (std::vector<RTLSignal *>::iterator it = signals.begin();
4580  it != signals.end(); ++it) {
4581 
4582  // Create a propagating signal wrapper that points to *it,
4583  // stops at the top level module, and is marked as a memory
4584  // signal.
4585  PropagatingSignal propSignal(*it, true, true);
4586  propSignals.push_back(propSignal);
4587 
4588  }
4589 
4590  return propSignals;
4591 
4592 }
4593 
4594 void GenerateRTL::addPropagatingMemorySignalsToFunction(Function *F) {
4595 
4596  std::vector<PropagatingSignal> aSignals, bSignals;
4597  aSignals = addPropagatingMemorySignalsToFunctionWithPostfix(F, "_a");
4598  bSignals = addPropagatingMemorySignalsToFunctionWithPostfix(F, "_b");
4599 
4600  RTLSignal *waitrequest = new RTLSignal("memory_controller_waitrequest", "");
4601  waitrequest->setType("input");
4602  PropagatingSignal propWaitrequest(waitrequest, true, true);
4603 
4604  PropagatingSignals *ps = alloc->getPropagatingSignals();
4605  ps->addPropagatingSignalsToFunctionNamed(F->getName().str(), aSignals);
4606  ps->addPropagatingSignalsToFunctionNamed(F->getName().str(), bSignals);
4607  ps->addPropagatingSignalToFunctionNamed(F->getName().str(),
4608  propWaitrequest);
4609 }
4610 
4611 void GenerateRTL::addPropagatingSignalsToCustomVerilog(Function *F) {
4612 
4613  bool isCV = LEGUP_CONFIG->isCustomVerilog(*F);
4614  assert(
4615  isCV
4616  && "You can only add propagating signals to Custom Verilog functions.\n");
4617 
4618  bool requiresMemorySignals = LEGUP_CONFIG->customVerilogUsesMemory(*F);
4619  std::vector<CustomVerilogIO> cvIO =
4620  LEGUP_CONFIG->getCustomVerilogIOForFunction(F);
4621 
4622  for (std::vector<CustomVerilogIO>::iterator it = cvIO.begin();
4623  it != cvIO.end(); ++it) {
4624 
4625  CustomVerilogIO &cvIO = *it;
4626  RTLWidth width = RTLWidth(cvIO.bitFrom, cvIO.bitTo);
4627  RTLSignal *signal = new RTLSignal(cvIO.name, "", width);
4628 
4629  if (cvIO.isInput) {
4630  signal->setType("input");
4631  } else {
4632  signal->setType("output");
4633  }
4634 
4635  // Create the Propagating Signal wrapper
4636  //
4637  PropagatingSignal propSignal(signal);
4638  PropagatingSignals *ps = alloc->getPropagatingSignals();
4639  ps->addPropagatingSignalToFunctionNamed(F->getName().str(), propSignal);
4640 
4641  }
4642 
4643  if (requiresMemorySignals) {
4644 
4645  addPropagatingMemorySignalsToFunction(F);
4646  }
4647 }
4648 
4649 // Adds propagating ports to a module or a wire if
4650 // the propagating signal stops propagating at this
4651 // function.
4652 //
4653 void GenerateRTL::addPropagatingPortsToModule(RTLModule *_rtl) {
4654 
4655  PropagatingSignals *ps = alloc->getPropagatingSignals();
4656  std::string functionName = Fp->getName().str();
4657 
4658  bool propagatingMemoryAdded = false;
4659 
4660  // Adds a signal that will propagate to a custom verilog module
4661  //
4662  assert(!(LEGUP_CONFIG->isCustomVerilog(functionName)) &&
4663  "You can't process a custom verilog module!");
4664 
4665  std::vector<Function *> functions = getFunctionsCalledByFunction(Fp);
4666  std::vector<std::string> functionNames;
4667 
4668  for (std::vector<Function *>::iterator it = functions.begin();
4669  it != functions.end(); ++it) {
4670 
4671  Function *function = *it;
4672 
4673  std::vector<std::string>::iterator b = functionNames.begin();
4674  std::vector<std::string>::iterator e = functionNames.end();
4675  if (std::find(b, e, function->getName().str()) == e) {
4676  functionNames.push_back(function->getName().str());
4677  }
4678 
4679  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->isCustomVerilog(function->getName().str())) {
4680 
4681  // Custom Verilog Modules don't exist in the RTL, so we add
4682  // their propagating signals to the propagating signals
4683  // data structure whenever custom verilog modules are
4684  // instantiated.
4685  //
4686  addPropagatingSignalsToCustomVerilog(function);
4687  }
4688  }
4689 
4690  std::vector<PropagatingSignal *> signals =
4691  ps->getPropagatingSignalsForFunctionsWithNames(functionNames);
4692 
4693  for (std::vector<PropagatingSignal *>::iterator si = signals.begin();
4694  si != signals.end();) {
4695 
4696  PropagatingSignal propSignalCopy = **si;
4697  // PropagatingSignal *propSignal = *si;
4698  si++;
4699  RTLSignal *signal;
4700 
4701  // if local RAMs is turn on, and all RAMS are localized
4702  // for this function, then continue
4703  // MATHEW TODO: Fix this check for "memory_controller_waitrequest"
4704  /*
4705  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("LOCAL_RAMS") &&
4706  alloc->fctOnlyUsesLocalRAMs(Fp) &&
4707  propSignalCopy.getName() !=
4708  "memory_controller_waitrequest")
4709  continue;
4710  */
4711  if (propSignalCopy.stopsPropagatingAtFunction(Fp)) {
4712 
4713  // TODO: Account for multiple propagating signals that stop at the
4714  // same function and have the same name
4715  // What if two have the same name but one of them doesn't stop here?
4716 
4717  _rtl->addWire(propSignalCopy.getName(), propSignalCopy.getWidth());
4718  continue;
4719  }
4720 
4721  bool isPthreadsMemSignal = propSignalCopy.isMemory() && usesPthreads;
4722  string propSignalCopyName;
4723 
4724  if (isPthreadsMemSignal) {
4725  propSignalCopyName = propSignalCopy.getPthreadsMemSignalName();
4726  propSignalCopy.setShouldConnectToPthreadsMemName(true);
4727  } else {
4728  propSignalCopyName = propSignalCopy.getName();
4729  }
4730  if (propSignalCopy.getType() == "input") {
4731  signal = _rtl->addIn(propSignalCopyName, propSignalCopy.getWidth());
4732  } else if (propSignalCopy.getType() == "output") {
4733  signal =
4734  _rtl->addOut(propSignalCopyName, propSignalCopy.getWidth());
4735  }
4736 
4737  if (!isPthreadsMemSignal &&
4738  (propSignalCopy.isMerged() || propSignalCopy.isMemory()))
4739  signal->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
4740 
4741  // RTLSignal *previousSignal = propSignal->getSignal();
4742  propSignalCopy.setSignal(signal);
4743  ps->addPropagatingSignalToFunctionNamed(functionName, propSignalCopy);
4744 
4745  // if one of the propagating signals is memory_controller_enable_a
4746  // then an instantiated module uses memory and we don't need to
4747  // manually add the memory.
4748  //
4749  if (!propagatingMemoryAdded && propSignalCopy.isMemory())
4750  propagatingMemoryAdded = true;
4751  }
4752 
4753  bool requiresMemorySignals = false;
4754  if (!propagatingMemoryAdded)
4755  requiresMemorySignals = functionRequiresMemory(Fp);
4756 
4757  // Add the memory signals if the function needs memory and if the signals
4758  // were not already added.
4759  //
4760  if (!propagatingMemoryAdded && requiresMemorySignals && !usesPthreads) {
4761 
4762  // MATHEW TODO: generalize this for waitrequest signal
4763  RTLSignal *waitrequest = _rtl->addIn("memory_controller_waitrequest");
4764  waitrequest->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
4765  PropagatingSignal propWaitrequest(waitrequest, true, true);
4766  ps->addPropagatingSignalToFunctionNamed(functionName, propWaitrequest);
4767 
4768  if (!(LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("LOCAL_RAMS") &&
4769  alloc->fctOnlyUsesLocalRAMs(Fp))) {
4770  std::vector<PropagatingSignal> aSignals, bSignals;
4771  aSignals =
4772  addPropagatingMemorySignalsToModuleWithPostfix(_rtl, "_a");
4773  bSignals =
4774  addPropagatingMemorySignalsToModuleWithPostfix(_rtl, "_b");
4775 
4776  ps->addPropagatingSignalsToFunctionNamed(functionName, aSignals);
4777  ps->addPropagatingSignalsToFunctionNamed(functionName, bSignals);
4778  }
4779  }
4780 }
4781 
4782 void GenerateRTL::addDefaultPortsToModule(RTLModule *_rtl) {
4783  _rtl->addIn("clk");
4784  _rtl->addIn("clk2x");
4785  _rtl->addIn("clk1x_follower");
4786  _rtl->addIn("reset");
4787  _rtl->addIn("start");
4788  _rtl->addOutReg("finish");
4789 }
4790 
4791 void GenerateRTL::generateVariableDeclarationsSignalsMemory(
4792  RTLModule *t, Function *F, const std::string fctName,
4793  const std::string postfix, const std::string instanceName) {
4794  RTLSignal *en = rtl->find(fctName + "_memory_controller_enable" + postfix +
4795  instanceName);
4796 
4797  RTLSignal *addr = rtl->addWire(fctName + "_memory_controller_address" +
4798  postfix + instanceName,
4799  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1"));
4800 
4801  RTLSignal *we = rtl->find(fctName + "_memory_controller_write_enable" +
4802  postfix + instanceName);
4803 
4804  RTLSignal *in =
4805  rtl->addWire(fctName + "_memory_controller_in" + postfix + instanceName,
4806  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1"));
4807 
4808  RTLSignal *out =
4809  rtl->addReg(fctName + "_memory_controller_out" + postfix + instanceName,
4810  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1"));
4811 
4812  const RTLSignal *defaultDriver = out->getDefaultDriver();
4813  if (!defaultDriver) {
4814  out->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
4815  }
4816 
4817  t->addOut("memory_controller_enable" + postfix)->connect(en);
4818  t->addOut("memory_controller_address" + postfix)->connect(addr);
4819  t->addOut("memory_controller_write_enable" + postfix)->connect(we);
4820  t->addOut("memory_controller_in" + postfix)->connect(in);
4821 
4822  if (alloc->usesGenericRAMs()) {
4823  RTLSignal *size = rtl->addWire(fctName + "_memory_controller_size" +
4824  postfix + instanceName,
4825  RTLWidth(2));
4826  t->addOut("memory_controller_size" + postfix)->connect(size);
4827  }
4828  t->addOut("memory_controller_out" + postfix)->connect(out);
4829 }
4830 
4831 void GenerateRTL::generatePropagatingSignalDeclarations(RTLModule *t,
4832  Function *F) {
4833 
4834  std::string fctName = F->getName();
4835 
4836  // Get a pointer to the PropagatingSignals singleton
4837  //
4838  PropagatingSignals *ps = alloc->getPropagatingSignals();
4839  std::vector<PropagatingSignal *> signals =
4840  ps->getPropagatingSignalsForFunctionNamed(F->getName().str());
4841 
4842  // Iterate through propagating signals and add them to the variable declarations
4843  //
4844  for (std::vector<PropagatingSignal *>::iterator si = signals.begin();
4845  si != signals.end(); ++si) {
4846 
4847  PropagatingSignal *propSignal = *si;
4848  std::string signalType = propSignal->getType();
4849  RTLSignal *signal;
4850  RTLSignal *
4851  wire; // For connecting the propagating signal to the current module
4852 
4853  // Add the propagating signal as either an input or an output
4854  //
4855  std::string propSignalName;
4856  if (propSignal->shouldConnectToPthreadsMemName()) {
4857  propSignal->setShouldConnectToPthreadsMemName(false);
4858  propSignalName = propSignal->getPthreadsMemSignalName();
4859  } else {
4860  propSignalName = propSignal->getName();
4861  }
4862 
4863  if (signalType == "input") {
4864  signal = t->addIn(propSignalName, propSignal->getWidth());
4865 
4866  std::string existingSignalName;
4867  existingSignalName = propSignal->getName();
4868 
4869  wire = rtl->find(existingSignalName); // For inputs we can connect
4870  // the signal directly
4871  } else { // Propagating signals can only be inputs or outputs, so this
4872  // is an output
4873  signal = t->addOut(propSignalName, propSignal->getWidth());
4874  wire = rtl->find(fctName + "_" +
4875  propSignal->getName()); // Outputs must be
4876  // connected through the
4877  // state machine
4878  }
4879 
4880  signal->connect(wire);
4881  }
4882 }
4883 
4884 void GenerateRTL::addTagOffsetParamToModule(Function *F, const int numThreads,
4885  const int instanceNum,
4886  RTLModule *t) {
4887 
4888  // add a defparam for the tag
4889  // used to steer memory accesses to correct instance of RAM
4890  // for arrays (allocas) in parallel functions
4891  std::string tag_offset = "tag_offset";
4892 
4893  if (numThreads) {
4894  std::string totalThreads;
4895  if (F->hasFnAttribute("totalNumThreads")) {
4896  tag_offset +=
4897  "*" +
4898  F->getFnAttribute("totalNumThreads").getValueAsString().str();
4899  }
4900  tag_offset += "+" + utostr(instanceNum);
4901  }
4902  t->addParam("tag_offset", tag_offset);
4903 }
4904 
4905 void GenerateRTL::generateModuleInstantiation(Function *F, CallInst *CI,
4906  const int numThreads,
4907  const std::string fctName,
4908  const std::string functionType,
4909  int loopIndex) {
4910 
4911  std::string instanceName = getInstanceName(CI, loopIndex);
4912 
4913  RTLSignal *start = rtl->addReg(fctName + "_start" + instanceName);
4914  RTLSignal *finish = rtl->addWire(fctName + "_finish" + instanceName);
4915 
4916  RTLModule *t = rtl->addModule(fctName, fctName + instanceName);
4917  if (!numThreads) {
4918  calledModulesToRtlMap[F] = t;
4919  generatePropagatingSignalDeclarations(t, F);
4920  }
4921 
4922  t->addIn("clk")->connect(rtl->find("clk"));
4923  t->addIn("clk2x")->connect(rtl->find("clk2x"));
4924  t->addIn("clk1x_follower")->connect(rtl->find("clk1x_follower"));
4925  t->addIn("reset")->connect(rtl->find("reset"));
4926  t->addIn("start")->connect(start);
4927  t->addOut("finish")->connect(finish);
4928 
4929  if (!LEGUP_CONFIG->isCustomVerilog(*F)) {
4930  addTagOffsetParamToModule(F, numThreads, getInstanceNum(CI, loopIndex),
4931  t);
4932  }
4933 
4934  const Type *rT = F->getReturnType();
4935  // if it is a non-void function, or it is a pthread call wrapper with a
4936  // return value
4937  // insert the return_val output port and connect to the return_val wire
4938  // for the instance
4939  if (rT->getTypeID() != Type::VoidTyID) {
4940  RTLWidth T(rT);
4941  RTLSignal *ret =
4942  rtl->addWire(fctName + "_return_val" + instanceName, T);
4943  t->addOut("return_val", T)->connect(ret);
4944  }
4945 
4946  // MATHEW: this is commented out for sequential functions
4947  // can you generalize generatePropagatingSignalDeclarations
4948  // for parallel functions?
4949  if (numThreads) {
4950  generateVariableDeclarationsSignalsMemory(t, F, fctName, "_a",
4951  instanceName);
4952  generateVariableDeclarationsSignalsMemory(t, F, fctName, "_b",
4953  instanceName);
4954 
4955  RTLSignal *wait = rtl->addReg(
4956  fctName + "_memory_controller_waitrequest" + instanceName);
4957  wait->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
4958  t->addOut("memory_controller_waitrequest")->connect(wait);
4959  }
4960 
4961  for (Function::arg_iterator i = F->arg_begin(), e = F->arg_end(); i != e;
4962  ++i) {
4963  //// TODO: fix this
4964  std::string argName = alloc->verilogNameFunction(i, F);
4965  std::string name = fctName + "_" + argName + instanceName;
4966  // if argument name is threadID and there are parallel instances
4967  // this means that it's using OpenMP threads
4968  // as the threadID pass in induction variable i
4969  // this assigns a threadID for each thread
4970  // for when they are accessing mutexes,
4971  // just using i will make threadID the same when they are from different
4972  // avalon accelerators
4973  // hence we use threadMutexID (which is equal to base address of that
4974  // avalon accelerator) + i
4975  if (numThreads && argName == "arg_threadID" &&
4976  functionType == "omp_function") {
4977  // for OpenMP
4978  t->addOut(argName, RTLWidth(i->getType()))
4979  ->connect(rtl->addConst(utostr(loopIndex), 32));
4980  } else if (numThreads && argName == "arg_threadMutexID") {
4981  RTLSignal *arg = rtl->addWire(name, RTLWidth(i->getType()));
4982  t->addOut(argName, RTLWidth(i->getType()))
4983  ->connect(rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Add)->setOperands(
4984  arg, rtl->addConst(utostr(loopIndex), 32)));
4985  } else {
4986  RTLSignal *arg = rtl->addWire(name, RTLWidth(i->getType()));
4987  t->addOut(argName, RTLWidth(i->getType()))->connect(arg);
4988  }
4989  }
4990 }
4991 
4992 void GenerateRTL::generateVariableDeclarations(CallInst *CI,
4993  const std::string functionType) {
4994 
4995  // get the number of threads
4996  int numThreads = getNumThreads(CI);
4997 
4998  Function *F = getCalledFunction(CI);
4999  if (calledModules.find(F) != calledModules.end() && !numThreads)
5000  return;
5001  calledModules.insert(F);
5002 
5003  std::string fctName = verilogName(F);
5004  if (numThreads) {
5005  for (int index = 0; index < numThreads; index++) {
5006  generateModuleInstantiation(F, CI, numThreads, fctName,
5007  functionType, index);
5008  }
5009  } else {
5010  generateModuleInstantiation(F, CI, numThreads, fctName, functionType);
5011  }
5012 
5013  // create arbiter instance to arbitrate between memory signals
5014  // from parallel functions
5015  if (numThreads > 1 && functionType != "legup_wrapper_pthreadcall") {
5016  generateRoundRobinArbiterDeclaration(fctName, numThreads);
5017  }
5018 }
5019 
5020 // generate memory controller signals for the master thread (main FSM)
5021 // i.e., waitrequest and readdata logic
5022 void GenerateRTL::generatePthreadMasterThreadLogic() {
5023 
5024  std::string name = Fp->getName().str();
5025  RTLSignal *gnt = rtl->find(name + "_memory_controller_gnt_0");
5026  RTLSignal *wait = rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest");
5027  RTLSignal *waitParent = rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest_arbiter");
5028  RTLSignal *req = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)
5029  ->setOperands(rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_a"),
5030  rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_b"));
5031  RTLSignal *notGnt = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Not)->setOperands(gnt);
5032  wait->connect(
5033  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)->setOperands(waitParent,
5034  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(req, notGnt)));
5035 
5036  // create the logic to take in the readdata coming from the memory controller
5037  std::string funcName = "memory_controller";
5038  createMemoryReaddataLogicForParallelInstance(gnt, funcName, "_a");
5039  createMemoryReaddataLogicForParallelInstance(gnt, funcName, "_b");
5040 }
5041 
5042 //create arbiter instance for pthread parallel functions
5043 void GenerateRTL::generatePthreadArbiter(
5044  const std::set<CallInst*> pthreadFunctions) {
5045 
5046  // set arbiter usage
5047  LEGUP_CONFIG->setArbiterUsage(true);
5048 
5049  std::string arbiterName = "round_robin_arbiter";
5050 
5051  std::string parentFctName =
5052  (*(pthreadFunctions.begin()))->getParent()->getParent()->getName();
5053  RTLModule *t = rtl->addModule(arbiterName,
5054  arbiterName + "_" + parentFctName + "_inst");
5055 
5056  t->addIn("clk")->connect(rtl->find("clk"));
5057  t->addIn("rst_an")
5058  ->connect(rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Not)->setOperands(rtl->find("reset")));
5059 
5060  // only connect the waitrequest signal to the arbiter in the hybrid case
5061  // you only need to stall the arbiter when waiting for off-chip memory
5062  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->isHybridFlow())
5063  t->addIn("waitrequest")
5064  ->connect(rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest"));
5065  else
5066  t->addIn("waitrequest")->connect(ZERO);
5067 
5068  // connect memory controller enable signals to arbiter request input
5069  // connect arbiter grant output to memory controller grant signals
5070  connectMemoryControllerSignalsToArbiter(t, pthreadFunctions, parentFctName);
5071 
5072  // connect all other memory controller signals to
5073  // module ouput depending on the grant signal
5074  connectMemoryControllerSignalsToModuleOutputWithArbiterGrant(
5075  pthreadFunctions, parentFctName, "_a");
5076  connectMemoryControllerSignalsToModuleOutputWithArbiterGrant(
5077  pthreadFunctions, parentFctName, "_b");
5078 }
5079 
5080 void GenerateRTL::connectMemoryControllerSignalsToArbiter(
5081  RTLModule *t, const std::set<CallInst *> pthreadFunctions,
5082  const std::string parentFctName) {
5083 
5084  // need to concatenate memory_controller_enable signals from each parallel
5085  // function instance
5086  // and connect to the request input of arbiter
5087  RTLSignal *req, *gnt, *en;
5088  std::vector<RTLSignal *> reqVector, gntVector;
5089  std::string instanceName, pthreadFuncName;
5090  int numThreads, arbiterSize = 0;
5091  CallInst *CI;
5092  int index;
5093  // build a vector of signals
5094  for (std::set<CallInst *>::const_iterator it = pthreadFunctions.begin();
5095  it != pthreadFunctions.end(); it++) {
5096  CI = *it;
5097  numThreads = getNumThreads(CI);
5098  for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++) {
5099  instanceName = getInstanceName(CI, i);
5100  index = getInstanceNum(CI, i);
5101  pthreadFuncName = CI->getCalledFunction()->getName();
5102  en = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)->setOperands(
5103  rtl->find(pthreadFuncName + "_memory_controller_enable_a" +
5104  instanceName),
5105  rtl->find(pthreadFuncName + "_memory_controller_enable_b" +
5106  instanceName));
5107  req = en;
5108  // add the memory controller enable signals
5109  // from each pthread instance
5110  reqVector.push_back(req);
5111 
5112  gnt = rtl->find(pthreadFuncName + "_memory_controller_gnt_" +
5113  utostr(index));
5114  // add the memory controller grant signals
5115  // from each pthread instance
5116  gntVector.push_back(gnt);
5117  }
5118  arbiterSize += numThreads;
5119  }
5120 
5121  // add the main thread's memory controller enable signals
5122  en = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)
5123  ->setOperands(rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_a"),
5124  rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_b"));
5125  reqVector.push_back(en);
5126  // increment arbiterSize since for main thread's
5127  // memory controller signals
5128  arbiterSize++;
5129 
5130  // build the operation out of the vector of
5131  // memory_controller_enable signals
5132  RTLOp *reqOp = rtl->recursivelyAddOp(RTLOp::Concat, reqVector, arbiterSize);
5133  assert(reqOp);
5134  // connect to the request input
5135  t->addIn("req_in", RTLWidth(arbiterSize))->connect(reqOp);
5136 
5137  // add the gnt signal for main thread
5138  gnt = rtl->addWire(parentFctName + "_memory_controller_gnt_0");
5139  gntVector.push_back(gnt);
5140  // build the operation out of the vector of
5141  // memory_controller_gnt signals
5142  RTLOp *gntOp = rtl->recursivelyAddOp(RTLOp::Concat, gntVector, arbiterSize);
5143  assert(gntOp);
5144 
5145  // connect to grant output from arbiter
5146  t->addOut("grant_final", RTLWidth(arbiterSize))->connect(gntOp);
5147 
5148  // set the number of threads (number of inputs) for arbiter
5149  t->addParam("N", utostr(arbiterSize));
5150 }
5151 void GenerateRTL::connectMemoryControllerSignalsToModuleOutputWithArbiterGrant(
5152  const std::set<CallInst *> pthreadFunctions,
5153  const std::string parentFctName, const std::string postfix) {
5154 
5155  // get the memory controller output ports for this module
5156  RTLSignal *en = rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_arbiter" + postfix);
5157  RTLSignal *we =
5158  rtl->find("memory_controller_write_enable_arbiter" + postfix);
5159  RTLSignal *addr = rtl->find("memory_controller_address_arbiter" + postfix);
5160  RTLSignal *in = rtl->find("memory_controller_in_arbiter" + postfix);
5161  RTLSignal *size = rtl->find("memory_controller_size_arbiter" + postfix);
5162 
5163  // for parallel instances
5164  // connect memory controller signals of parallel instance to
5165  // parent memory controller signals if gnt signal is asserted for that
5166  // instance
5167  for (std::set<CallInst *>::const_iterator it = pthreadFunctions.begin();
5168  it != pthreadFunctions.end(); it++) {
5169  CallInst *CI = *it;
5170  int numThreads = getNumThreads(CI);
5171  for (int i = 0; i < numThreads; i++) {
5172  std::string instanceName = getInstanceName(CI, i);
5173  int index = getInstanceNum(CI, i);
5174 
5175  std::string pthreadFuncName = CI->getCalledFunction()->getName();
5176 
5177  RTLSignal *gnt_inst = rtl->find(
5178  pthreadFuncName + "_memory_controller_gnt_" + utostr(index));
5179 
5180  RTLSignal *en_inst =
5181  rtl->find(pthreadFuncName + "_memory_controller_enable" +
5182  postfix + instanceName);
5183  RTLSignal *we_inst =
5184  rtl->find(pthreadFuncName + "_memory_controller_write_enable" +
5185  postfix + instanceName);
5186  RTLSignal *addr_inst =
5187  rtl->find(pthreadFuncName + "_memory_controller_address" +
5188  postfix + instanceName);
5189  RTLSignal *in_inst =
5190  rtl->find(pthreadFuncName + "_memory_controller_in" + postfix +
5191  instanceName);
5192  RTLSignal *size_inst =
5193  rtl->find(pthreadFuncName + "_memory_controller_size" +
5194  postfix + instanceName);
5195 
5196  en->addCondition(gnt_inst, en_inst);
5197  we->addCondition(gnt_inst, we_inst);
5198  addr->addCondition(gnt_inst, addr_inst);
5199  in->addCondition(gnt_inst, in_inst);
5200  size->addCondition(gnt_inst, size_inst);
5201  }
5202  }
5203 
5204  // grant signal for main thread
5205  RTLSignal *gnt_main = rtl->find(parentFctName + "_memory_controller_gnt_0");
5206  // memory controller signals for main thread
5207  RTLSignal *en_main = rtl->find("memory_controller_enable" + postfix);
5208  RTLSignal *we_main = rtl->find("memory_controller_write_enable" + postfix);
5209  RTLSignal *addr_main = rtl->find("memory_controller_address" + postfix);
5210  RTLSignal *in_main = rtl->find("memory_controller_in" + postfix);
5211  RTLSignal *size_main = rtl->find("memory_controller_size" + postfix);
5212 
5213  // connect main thread's memory controller signals
5214  // to module output
5215  en->addCondition(gnt_main, en_main);
5216  we->addCondition(gnt_main, we_main);
5217  addr->addCondition(gnt_main, addr_main);
5218  in->addCondition(gnt_main, in_main);
5219  size->addCondition(gnt_main, size_main);
5220 }
5221 
5222 // create arbiter instance for when parallel functions are used
5223 void
5224 GenerateRTL::generateRoundRobinArbiterDeclaration(const std::string fctName,
5225  const int parallelInstances) {
5226 
5227  // set arbiter usage
5228  LEGUP_CONFIG->setArbiterUsage(true);
5229 
5230  std::string arbiterName = "round_robin_arbiter";
5231 
5232  RTLModule *t = rtl->addModule(arbiterName,
5233  arbiterName + "_" + fctName + "_inst");
5234 
5235  t->addIn("clk")->connect(rtl->find("clk"));
5236  //t->addIn("rst_an")->connect(rtl->find("reset"));
5237  t->addIn("rst_an")->connect(
5238  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Not)->setOperands(rtl->find("reset")));
5239 // if (LEGUP_CONFIG->isHybridFlow())
5240  t->addIn("waitrequest")->connect(
5241  rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest"));
5242 // else
5243 // t->addIn("waitrequest")->connect(ZERO);
5244 
5245  //need to concatenate memory_controller_enable signals from each parallel function instance
5246  //and connect to the request signal
5247  //build a vector of signals
5248  RTLSignal *req, *en;
5249  std::vector<RTLSignal*> sigVector, bramAccessVector;
5250  std::string instanceNum, instanceNum2;
5251  for (int i = 0; i < parallelInstances; i++) {
5252  instanceNum = "_inst" + utostr(i);
5253  /*
5254  sdram_sdram_stall = rtl->find("sdram_sdram_stall" + instanceNum);
5255 
5256  //if other instances accessed BRAM in previous cycle and this instance wants to access SDRAM in current cycle
5257  bram_sdram_stall = rtl->find("bram_sdram_stall" + instanceNum);
5258 
5259  //if other instances accessed BRAM in previous cycle and this instance wants to access BRAM in current cycle
5260  bram_bram_stall = rtl->find("bram_bram_stall" + instanceNum);
5261 
5262  sdram_bram_stall = rtl->find("sdram_bram_stall" + instanceNum);
5263  */
5264  en = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)->setOperands(
5265  rtl->find(
5266  fctName + "_memory_controller_enable_a_inst"
5267  + utostr(i)),
5268  rtl->find(
5269  fctName + "_memory_controller_enable_b_inst"
5270  + utostr(i)));
5271 
5272  //if (LEGUP_CONFIG->numAccelerators() > 0) {
5273  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->isHybridFlow()) {
5274  req = en;
5275 // gnt_stall = rtl->find("gnt_stall" + instancenum);
5276 // req = rtl->addop(rtlop::and)->setoperands(en,
5277 // rtl->addop(rtlop::not)->setoperands(gnt_stall));
5278  } else {
5279  req = en;
5280  }
5281 
5282  sigVector.push_back(req);
5283  }
5284 
5285  //build the operation out of the vector of signals
5286  RTLOp *reqOp = rtl->recursivelyAddOp(RTLOp::Concat, sigVector,
5287  parallelInstances);
5288  //connect to the request input
5289  t->addIn("req_in", RTLWidth(parallelInstances))->connect(reqOp);
5290 
5291  //connecting the grant output
5292  sigVector.clear();
5293  for (int i = 0; i < parallelInstances; i++) {
5294  // RTLSignal *sig = rtl->addWire("gnt_" + utostr(i));
5295  RTLSignal *sig =
5296  rtl->find(fctName + "_memory_controller_gnt_" + utostr(i));
5297  sigVector.push_back(sig);
5298  }
5299  // build the operation out of the vector of signals
5300  RTLOp *gntOp = rtl->recursivelyAddOp(RTLOp::Concat, sigVector,
5301  parallelInstances);
5302 
5303  //connect to grant output from arbiter
5304  t->addOut("grant_final", RTLWidth(parallelInstances))->connect(gntOp);
5305 
5306  t->addParam("N", utostr(parallelInstances));
5307 }
5308 
5309 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getFloatingPointConstantSignal(const ConstantFP *c) {
5310  SmallString<40> E;
5311  c->getValueAPF().bitcastToAPInt().toStringUnsigned(E, 16);
5312  std::string str = utostr(getBitWidth(c->getType())) + "'h";
5313  str = str.append(E.str());
5314  RTLSignal *ret = rtl->addConst(str, RTLWidth(c->getType()));
5315  return ret;
5316 }
5317 
5318 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getConstantSignal(const ConstantInt *c) {
5319  std::string str;
5320  // I can't use the abs() method because it doesn't work
5321  // when the APInt is the maximum negative value
5322  // ie. abs(-2^63) = -2^63 for a 64-bit number
5323  APInt val = c->getValue();
5324  std::string numStr = val.toString(10, true);
5325  //for some reason, when we have
5326  //i1 true, this returns -1 when you getValue()
5327  //so we add a case for when it is one and the bitwidth is 1
5328  //then remove the - sign from the front
5329  if (c->isOne() && c->getBitWidth() == 1) {
5330  // remove '-' sig
5331  assert(numStr[0] == '-');
5332  numStr.erase(0, 1);
5333  } else if (val.isNegative()) {
5334  // remove '-' sig
5335  assert(numStr[0] == '-');
5336  numStr.erase(0, 1);
5337  str = "-";
5338  }
5339 
5340  // needed for integers bigger than 32 bits (otherwise
5341  // Modelsim gives an error)
5342  str += utostr(getBitWidth(c->getType())) + "'d" + numStr;
5343 
5344  RTLSignal *ret = rtl->addConst(str, RTLWidth(c, MBW));
5345  return ret;
5346 }
5347 
5348 //NC changes... wrapper
5349 
5350 RTLSignal* GenerateRTL::getOpConstant(State *state, Constant *op) {
5351  int value = 0;
5352  return getOpConstant(state, op, value);
5353 }
5354 
5355 RTLSignal* GenerateRTL::getOpConstant(State *state, Constant *op, int &value) {
5356 
5357  //std::cout << "getOpConstant - value: " << value << std::endl;
5358 
5359  std::string str;
5360 
5361  if (const ConstantInt *c = dyn_cast<ConstantInt>(op)) {
5362  value = c->getSExtValue();
5363  return getConstantSignal(c);
5364  } else if (const ConstantFP *c = dyn_cast<ConstantFP>(op)) {
5365  //value is not important here.... I only use value for index which has to be integer....
5366  return getFloatingPointConstantSignal(c);
5367  } else if (isa<ConstantPointerNull>(op)) {
5368  RTLSignal *ret = rtl->addConst("0",
5369  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1"));
5370  value = 0;
5371  //std::cout << "getOpConstant - constantPointerNull - value set to: " << value << std::endl;
5372  return ret;
5373 
5374  } else if (ConstantExpr *ce = dyn_cast<ConstantExpr>(op)) {
5375  // ie. %st.04.i = getelementptr i64* bitcast (%struct.point* @p1 to i64*), i32 %indvar.i ;
5376  // where bitcast (%struct.point* @p1 to i64*) is the operand
5377  assert(ce->isCast());
5378  int opValue = 0;
5379  RTLSignal* r = getOp(state, ce->getOperand(0), opValue);
5380  value = opValue;
5381  //std::cout << "getOpConstant - ConstantExpr - value set to: " << value << std::endl;
5382  return r;
5383 
5384  // TODO LLVM 3.4 update: a case we _may_ need to deal with?
5385  } else if (ConstantVector *ca = dyn_cast<ConstantVector>(op)) {
5386  errs() << "ConstantVector: " << *ca << "\n";
5387  llvm_unreachable("ConstantVector support not implemented");
5388  // TODO LLVM 3.4 update: a new case we need to deal with (exhibited in chstone/adpcm)
5389  } else if (ConstantDataVector *ca = dyn_cast<ConstantDataVector>(op)) {
5390  errs() << "ConstantDataVector: " << *ca << "\n";
5391  llvm_unreachable("ConstantDataVector support not implemented");
5392  // TODO LLVM 3.4 update: a new case we need to deal with (exhibited in chstone/gsm, mandelbrot)
5393  } else if (ConstantAggregateZero *cz = dyn_cast<ConstantAggregateZero>(op)) {
5394  errs() << "ZeroInitializer: " << *cz << "\n";
5395  llvm_unreachable("ZeroInitializer support not implemented");
5396 
5397  } else if (isa<UndefValue>(op)) {
5398  std::cout << "Warning: Used undefined value. Setting to 0.\n";
5399  RTLSignal *ret = rtl->addConst("0", RTLWidth(op->getType()));
5400  value = 0;
5401  //std::cout << "getOpConstant - UndefValue - value set to: " << value << std::endl;
5402  return ret;
5403 
5404  } else if (isa<Function>(op)) {
5405  errs() << "Function pointer to: " << op->getName() << "\n";
5406  llvm_unreachable("Function pointers are unsupported");
5407 
5408  } else {
5409  errs() << *op << "\n";
5410  llvm_unreachable("Unknown constant operand");
5411  }
5412 }
5413 
5414 RTLSignal* GenerateRTL::getOpNonConstant(State *state, Value *op) {
5415 
5416  assert(!isa<Constant>(op));
5417 
5418  std::string wire = verilogName(op);
5419  std::string reg = wire + "_reg";
5420  if (state->isWaitingForPipeline() && isPipelined(op)) {
5421 
5422  BasicBlock *BB = state->getBasicBlock();
5423  assert(BB);
5424  std::string label = getPipelineLabel(BB);
5425  const Instruction *inductionVar = getInductionVar(BB);
5426  if (op == inductionVar) {
5427  wire = label + "_i_stage" + utostr(this->stage);
5428 
5429  //} else if (PHINode *phi = dyn_cast<PHINode>(op)) {
5430  /*
5431  } else if (isa<PHINode>(op)) {
5432  RTLSignal *phi = rtl->find(reg);
5433  return phi;
5434  */
5435 
5436  } else {
5437  RTLSignal *sig = getPipelineSignal(op, this->time);
5438  //errs() << "time: " << this->time << " op: " << *op << "\n";
5439  assert(sig);
5440  return sig;
5441  }
5442  reg = wire;
5443  }
5444 
5445  Instruction *I = dyn_cast<Instruction>(op);
5446  if (!I)
5447  return rtl->find(wire);
5448 
5449  //errs() << *I << "\n";
5450  //errs() << "type: " << verilogName(I) << " " <<
5451  // rtl->find(verilogName(I))->getType() << "\n";
5452 
5453  // Temporary solution: For compare instructions, we don't need
5454  // an output register. This is supposed to be done by
5455  // remove_conditional_register but it doesn't remove all reg.
5456  // Also true for operands to function args.. not sure how else to
5457  // remove these registers
5458  if ((isa<ICmpInst>(*I) || multi_cycle_force_wire_operand(I))
5459  && LEGUP_CONFIG->mc_remove_reg_from_icmp_instructions()) {
5460  return rtl->find(wire);
5461  }
5462 
5463  RTLSignal *signal = NULL;
5464  if (fromOtherState(op, state)) {
5465  signal = rtl->find(reg);
5466  } else {
5467  signal = rtl->find(wire);
5468  }
5469  return signal;
5470 }
5471 
5472 //NC changes... wrapper
5473 
5474 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getOp(State *state, Value *op) {
5475  int value = 0;
5476  return getOp(state, op, value);
5477 }
5478 
5479 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getOp(State *state, Value *op, int &value) {
5480  RTLSignal *ret = NULL;
5481 
5482  //std::cout << "start-getOp - input value: " << value << std::endl;
5483 
5484  ConstantExpr *CE = dyn_cast<ConstantExpr>(op);
5485  if (CE && CE->getOpcode() == Instruction::GetElementPtr) {
5486  int gepValue = 0;
5487  ret = getGEP(state, CE, gepValue);
5488  value = gepValue;
5489  //std::cout << "getOp - GEP - value set to: " << value << std::endl;
5490  } else {
5491  if (isa<GlobalVariable>(op) || isa<AllocaInst>(op)) {
5492  RAM *ram = getRam(op);
5493  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("LOCAL_RAMS")
5494  && alloc->isRAMLocaltoFct(Fp, ram)) {
5495  // no TAGs - base address is always 0
5496  ret = ZERO;
5497  value = 0;
5498  } else {
5499 
5500  // if there are multiple instances of this RAM
5501  // due to parallel threads
5502  // add an offset to the tag
5503  RTLSignal *tag;
5504  RTLSignal *originalTag = rtl->addConst("`" + ram->getTagAddrName(),
5505  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1"));
5506  if (ram->getNumInstances() > 1) {
5507  tag = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Add)->setOperands(
5508  originalTag,
5509  rtl->addConst("tag_addr_offset",
5510  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1")));
5511  } else {
5512  tag = originalTag;
5513  }
5514  ret = tag;
5515  }
5516  } else if (Constant *c = dyn_cast<Constant>(op)) {
5517  int opConstantValue = 0;
5518  ret = getOpConstant(state, c, opConstantValue);
5519  value = opConstantValue;
5520  //std::cout << "getOp - constant - value set to: " << value << std::endl;
5521  } else {
5522  ret = getOpNonConstant(state, op);
5523 
5524  }
5525  }
5526  return ret;
5527 
5528 }
5529 
5530 // taken from CBackend
5531 // For every branch between basic blocks we call this function.
5532 // 'CurBlock' is the last state (terminating state) of the basic block with the
5533 // branch, while 'Successor' is the first state of the successor basic block.
5534 // 'condition' is the RTL condition for transitioning from states
5535 // CurBlock->Successor
5536 // For every phi node in the successor basic block, we must assign the phi nodes
5537 // phi_temp register in the 'CurBlock' state
5538 // For instance, if the successor basic block has the phi:
5539 // %23 = phi i32 [ %37, %legup_memset_4.exit ],
5540 // [ 0, %legup_memset_4.exit.preheader ]
5541 // And the state 'CurBlock' is from basic block %legup_memset_4.exit
5542 // Then this function will connect the phi_temp register
5543 // verilogName(%23)_phi_temp to %37 during state 'CurBlock', if 'condition'
5544 // is true (so we are actually transitioning from from CurBlock->Successor)
5545 void GenerateRTL::generatePHICopiesForSuccessor(RTLSignal* condition,
5546  State *CurBlock, State *Successor) {
5547  assert(CurBlock);
5548  assert(Successor);
5549  if (!CurBlock->isTerminating())
5550  return;
5551  if (CurBlock->isWaitingForPipeline() && Successor->isWaitingForPipeline())
5552  return;
5553 
5554  const BasicBlock *incomingBB = CurBlock->getBasicBlock();
5555  assert(incomingBB);
5556 
5557  if (Successor->isWaitingForPipeline()) {
5558  // start the pipeline
5559  // TODO: this probably should be moved out of this function as it's not
5560  // really related to phi instructions, just we have access to the
5561  // 'condition' signal here
5562  std::string label = getPipelineLabel(Successor->getBasicBlock());
5563  rtl->find(label + "_pipeline_start")->addCondition(condition, ONE);
5564  }
5565 
5566  // check for phi nodes in successor
5567  for (State::const_iterator instr = Successor->begin(), ie =
5568  Successor->end(); instr != ie; ++instr) {
5569  Instruction *I = *instr;
5570  if (const PHINode *phi = dyn_cast<PHINode>(I)) {
5571  Value *IV = phi->getIncomingValueForBlock(incomingBB);
5572  RTLWidth width(I, MBW);
5573 
5574  RTLSignal *signal = NULL;
5575  if (CurBlock->isWaitingForPipeline()) {
5576  Instruction *IVinst = dyn_cast<Instruction>(IV);
5577  assert(IVinst);
5578  this->time = getMetadataInt(IVinst, "legup.pipeline.avail_time");
5579  }
5580  signal = getOp(CurBlock, IV);
5581  RTLSignal *phiWire = rtl->addWire(verilogName(I), width);
5582  RTLSignal *phiReg = rtl->addReg(verilogName(I) + "_reg", width);
5583  phiWire->addCondition(condition, signal, I);
5584  phiReg->addCondition(condition, phiWire, I);
5585  }
5586  }
5587 }
5588 
5589 RTLSignal *GenerateRTL::getTransitionOp(State *s) {
5590  RTLSignal *op = s->getTransitionSignal();
5591  if (op) {
5592  // ie. finish signal for functions
5593  return op;
5594  } else {
5595  return getOp(s, s->getTransitionVariable());
5596  }
5597 }
5598 
5599 // There are three types of transitions:
5600 // switch, branch, unconditional
5601 void GenerateRTL::generateTransition(RTLSignal *condition, State* s) {
5602  assert(s->getDefaultTransition());
5603 
5604  RTLSignal *curState = rtl->find("cur_state");
5605 
5606  // uncond
5607  if (s->getNumTransitions() == 1) {
5608  generatePHICopiesForSuccessor(condition, s, s->getDefaultTransition());
5609  curState->addCondition(condition,
5610  getStateSignal(s->getDefaultTransition()));
5611  // cond branch
5612  } else if (s->getNumTransitions() == 2) {
5613 
5614  RTLOp *trueBranch = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ);
5615  trueBranch->setOperand(0, getTransitionOp(s));
5616  trueBranch->setOperand(1, ONE);
5617 
5618  RTLOp *trueCond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And);
5619  trueCond->setOperand(0, condition);
5620  trueCond->setOperand(1, trueBranch);
5621 
5622  generatePHICopiesForSuccessor(trueCond, s, s->getTransitionState(0));
5623  curState->addCondition(trueCond,
5624  getStateSignal(s->getTransitionState(0)));
5625 
5626  RTLOp *falseBranch = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ);
5627  falseBranch->setOperand(0, getTransitionOp(s));
5628  falseBranch->setOperand(1, ZERO);
5629 
5630  RTLOp *falseCond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And);
5631  falseCond->setOperand(0, condition);
5632  falseCond->setOperand(1, falseBranch);
5633 
5634  generatePHICopiesForSuccessor(falseCond, s, s->getDefaultTransition());
5635  curState->addCondition(falseCond,
5636  getStateSignal(s->getDefaultTransition()));
5637 
5638  // switch
5639  } else {
5640  assert(s->getNumTransitions() > 0);
5641 
5642  RTLOp *defaultCond = NULL;
5643 
5644  for (unsigned i = 0, e = s->getNumTransitions() - 1; i != e; ++i) {
5645  RTLOp *varEq = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ);
5646  varEq->setOperand(0, getTransitionOp(s));
5647  varEq->setOperand(1, getOp(s, s->getTransitionValue(i)));
5648 
5649  RTLOp *eqCond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And);
5650  eqCond->setOperand(0, condition);
5651  eqCond->setOperand(1, varEq);
5652 
5653  generatePHICopiesForSuccessor(eqCond, s, s->getTransitionState(i));
5654  curState->addCondition(eqCond,
5655  getStateSignal(s->getTransitionState(i)));
5656 
5657  RTLOp *varNe = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::NE);
5658  varNe->setOperand(0, getTransitionOp(s));
5659  varNe->setOperand(1, getOp(s, s->getTransitionValue(i)));
5660 
5661  if (!defaultCond) {
5662  defaultCond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And);
5663  defaultCond->setOperand(0, condition);
5664  defaultCond->setOperand(1, varNe);
5665  } else {
5666  RTLOp *newCond = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And);
5667  newCond->setOperand(0, defaultCond);
5668  newCond->setOperand(1, varNe);
5669  defaultCond = newCond;
5670  }
5671  }
5672 
5673  // default case
5674  generatePHICopiesForSuccessor(defaultCond, s,
5675  s->getDefaultTransition());
5676  curState->addCondition(defaultCond,
5677  getStateSignal(s->getDefaultTransition()));
5678 
5679  }
5680 }
5681 
5682 void GenerateRTL::generateDatapath() {
5683  std::string indent = std::string(1, '\t');
5684 
5685  FiniteStateMachine *fsm = sched->getFSM(Fp);
5686  assert(fsm->getNumStates() > 0);
5687 
5688  RTLSignal *curState = rtl->find("cur_state");
5689 
5690  PropagatingSignals *ps = alloc->getPropagatingSignals();
5691  bool shouldConnectMemorySignals = usesPthreads
5692  || ps->functionUsesMemory(Fp->getName());
5693 
5694  for (FiniteStateMachine::iterator state = fsm->begin(), se = fsm->end();
5695  state != se; ++state) {
5696 
5697  //const BasicBlock *b = state->getBasicBlock();
5698  //Out << indent << "/* " << b->getParent()->getName() << ": " <<
5699  // b->getName() << "*/\n";
5700 
5701  RTLOp *transition;
5702 
5703  RTLOp *inState = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ);
5704  inState->setOperand(0, curState);
5705  inState->setOperand(1, getStateSignal(state));
5706 
5707  if (shouldConnectMemorySignals) {
5708 
5709  RTLOp *waitReqHigh = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ);
5710  waitReqHigh->setOperand(0,
5711  rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest"));
5712  waitReqHigh->setOperand(1, ONE);
5713 
5714  RTLOp *waitReqLow = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ);
5715  waitReqLow->setOperand(0,
5716  rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest"));
5717  waitReqLow->setOperand(1, ZERO);
5718  RTLOp *waitReq = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And);
5719  waitReq->setOperand(0, inState);
5720  waitReq->setOperand(1, waitReqHigh);
5721 
5722  transition = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And);
5723  transition->setOperand(0, inState);
5724  transition->setOperand(1, waitReqLow);
5725 
5726  curState->addCondition(waitReq, getStateSignal(state));
5727 
5728  } else {
5729  transition = inState;
5730  }
5731  // print finishing multi-cycle instructions
5732  for (State::iterator instr = state->begin(), ie = state->end();
5733  instr != ie; ++instr) {
5734 
5735  Instruction *I = *instr;
5736 
5737  // find the verilog command for this instruction
5738  this->state = state;
5739 
5740  // call appropriate visitXXXX() function
5741  visit(*I);
5742 
5743  // declare usage of instruction to Timing/Area estimator
5744  setOperationUsageFunction(I);
5745  }
5746 
5747  // generate loop pipeline basic block instructions
5748  if (state->isWaitingForPipeline()) {
5749  BasicBlock *BB = state->getBasicBlock();
5750  assert(BB);
5751  pipeRTLFile() << "Generating datapath for loop pipeline state: "
5752  << state->getName() << "\n";
5753  this->state = state;
5754  for (BasicBlock::iterator I = BB->begin(), ie = BB->end(); I != ie;
5755  ++I) {
5756  this->stage = getMetadataInt(I, "legup.pipeline.stage");
5757  this->time = getMetadataInt(I, "legup.pipeline.start_time");
5758  visit(*I);
5759  setOperationUsageFunction(I);
5760  }
5761 
5762  generateTransition(transition, state);
5763 
5764  // these member variables shouldn't be used anymore
5765  this->time = -1;
5766  this->stage = -1;
5767  }
5768 
5769  generateTransition(transition, state);
5770 
5771  }
5772  RTLOp *reset = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::EQ);
5773  reset->setOperand(0, rtl->find("reset"));
5774  reset->setOperand(1, ONE);
5775  curState->addCondition(reset, rtl->addConst("0", curState->getWidth()));
5776 }
5777 
5778 void GenerateRTL::generateModuleDeclarationSignals(State *wait,
5779  std::string postfix) {
5780 
5781  // print memory controller instantiation
5782  RTLSignal *mem_enable, *addr, *we, *in, *size;
5783  RTLSignal *mem_enable_wire, *addr_wire, *we_wire, *in_wire, *size_wire;
5784  RTLWidth wa("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_ADDR_SIZE-1");
5785  RTLWidth wd("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1");
5786 
5787  RTLWidth ws(2);
5788 
5789  // if this module uses Pthreads, add postfix _arbiter to the ports
5790  // but add a wire without _arbiter which will be used in the main FSM (same
5791  // as in without pthreads)
5792  // postfix _arbiter is needed since the normal memory controller signals
5793  // (without _arbiter)
5794  // which are assigned in the FSM are used as request signals to the arbiter
5795  if (usesPthreads) {
5796  mem_enable = rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_arbiter" + postfix);
5797  // rtl->addOut("memory_controller_enable_arbiter" + postfix);
5798  mem_enable_wire = rtl->addWire("memory_controller_enable" + postfix);
5799  mem_enable_wire->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
5800  connectSignalToDriverInState(mem_enable_wire, ZERO, wait);
5801 
5802  addr = rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_arbiter" + postfix);
5803  // rtl->addOut("memory_controller_address_arbiter" + postfix, wa);
5804  addr_wire = rtl->addWire("memory_controller_address" + postfix, wa);
5805  addr_wire->setDefaultDriver(rtl->addConst("0", wa));
5806  connectSignalToDriverInState(addr_wire, rtl->addConst("0", wa), wait);
5807 
5808  we = rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_arbiter" + postfix);
5809  // rtl->addOut("memory_controller_write_enable_arbiter" + postfix);
5810  we_wire = rtl->addWire("memory_controller_write_enable" + postfix);
5811  we_wire->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
5812  connectSignalToDriverInState(we_wire, ZERO, wait);
5813 
5814  in = rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_arbiter" + postfix);
5815  // rtl->addOut("memory_controller_in_arbiter" + postfix, wd);
5816  in_wire = rtl->addWire("memory_controller_in" + postfix, wd);
5817  in_wire->setDefaultDriver(rtl->addConst("0", wd));
5818  connectSignalToDriverInState(in_wire, rtl->addConst("0", wd), wait);
5819 
5820  if (alloc->usesGenericRAMs()) {
5821  size = rtl->find("memory_controller_size_arbiter" + postfix);
5822  // rtl->addOut("memory_controller_size_arbiter" + postfix, ws);
5823  size_wire = rtl->addWire("memory_controller_size" + postfix, ws);
5824  size_wire->setDefaultDriver(rtl->addConst("0", ws));
5825  connectSignalToDriverInState(size_wire, rtl->addConst("0", ws),
5826  wait);
5827  }
5828 
5829  // rtl->addIn("memory_controller_out_arbiter" + postfix, wd);
5830  rtl->addWire("memory_controller_out" + postfix, wd);
5831 
5832  // set default drivers and connect them to each state
5833  mem_enable->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
5834  connectSignalToDriverInState(mem_enable, ZERO, wait);
5835  addr->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
5836  connectSignalToDriverInState(addr, rtl->addConst("0", wa), wait);
5837  we->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
5838  connectSignalToDriverInState(we, ZERO, wait);
5839  in->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
5840  connectSignalToDriverInState(in, rtl->addConst("0", wd), wait);
5841 
5842  if (alloc->usesGenericRAMs()) {
5843  size->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
5844  connectSignalToDriverInState(size, rtl->addConst("0", ws), wait);
5845  }
5846  }
5847 }
5848 
5849 void GenerateRTL::generateModuleDeclaration() {
5850  ZERO = rtl->addConst("0");
5851  ONE = rtl->addConst("1");
5852 
5853  // initialize state signals
5854  FiniteStateMachine::iterator stateIter = fsm->begin();
5855  for (; stateIter != fsm->end(); stateIter++) {
5856  State *s = stateIter;
5857  // we will fix the name/value later - after generating function calls
5858  stateSignals[s] = rtl->addParam("state_placeholder", "placeholder");
5859  }
5860 
5861  // add parameters for tag offset
5862  // which is used if there are multiple instances of a RAM
5863  // for pthreads/openmp
5864  addTagOffsetParameterToModule();
5865 
5866  addDefaultPortsToModule(rtl);
5867 
5868  // width will be set later
5869  rtl->addReg("cur_state");
5870 
5871  addPropagatingPortsToModule(rtl);
5872 
5873  FiniteStateMachine *fsm = sched->getFSM(Fp);
5874  State *waitState = fsm->begin();
5875 
5876  const Type *ret = Fp->getReturnType();
5877 
5878  if (ret->getTypeID() != Type::VoidTyID) {
5879  rtl->addOutReg("return_val", RTLWidth(ret));
5880 
5881  // initialize the return_val to 0 in the wait state
5882  RTLSignal *ret = rtl->find("return_val");
5883  connectSignalToDriverInState(ret, rtl->addConst("0", ret->getWidth()),
5884  waitState);
5885  }
5886 
5887  // function arguments are inputs
5888  for (Function::arg_iterator i = Fp->arg_begin(), e = Fp->arg_end(); i != e;
5889  ++i) {
5890  rtl->addIn(verilogName(i), RTLWidth(i->getType()));
5891  }
5892 
5893  // TODO:MATHEW
5894  // should default memory signals to 0
5895  generateModuleDeclarationSignals(waitState, "_a");
5896  generateModuleDeclarationSignals(waitState, "_b");
5897  // if Pthreads are used
5898  if (usesPthreads) {
5899  // the waitrequest signal is OR'ed with logic from arbiter
5900  // memory_controller_waitrequest = memory_controller_waitrequest_arbiter
5901  // || request is made but not granted by arbiter
5902  // rtl->addIn("memory_controller_waitrequest_arbiter");
5903  rtl->addWire("memory_controller_waitrequest");
5904  }
5905 
5906  // wait state waits until start signal is asserted
5907  waitState->setTransitionSignal(rtl->find("start"));
5908 
5909  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->find("finish"), ZERO, waitState);
5910 }
5911 
5912 bool ignoreInstruction(const Instruction *I) {
5913  // ignore stores (don't need a wire/reg)
5914  if (I->getType()->getTypeID() == Type::VoidTyID)
5915  return true;
5916  // ignore allocations
5917  if (isa<AllocaInst>(I))
5918  return true;
5919  // ignore printf calls
5920  if (isaDummyCall(I))
5921  return true;
5922 
5923  return false;
5924 }
5925 
5926 // For every instruction create:
5927 // 1) wire named verilogName(I)
5928 // 2) register named verilogName(I) + "_reg"
5929 void GenerateRTL::createRTLSignals() {
5930 
5931  // create signals for each instruction
5932  createRTLSignalsForInstructions();
5933 
5934  // create signals for local RAMs
5935  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("LOCAL_RAMS")) {
5936  createRTLSignalsForLocalRams();
5937  }
5938 }
5939 
5940 void GenerateRTL::createRTLSignalsForInstructions() {
5941 
5942  for (inst_iterator i = inst_begin(Fp), e = inst_end(Fp); i != e; ++i) {
5943  const Instruction *I = &*i;
5944 
5945  if (ignoreInstruction(I))
5946  continue;
5947 
5948  if (I->hasNUses(0))
5949  continue; // ignore instructions with no uses
5950 
5951  std::string wire = verilogName(*I);
5952 
5953  std::string reg = wire + "_reg";
5954 
5955  RTLWidth w(I, MBW);
5956  if (!rtl->exists(wire))
5957  rtl->addWire(wire, w);
5958  if (!rtl->exists(reg))
5959  rtl->addReg(reg, w);
5960  }
5961 }
5962 
5963 void GenerateRTL::createRTLSignalsForLocalRams() {
5964 
5965  for (Allocation::const_ram_iterator i = alloc->ram_begin(), e =
5966  alloc->ram_end(); i != e; ++i) {
5967 
5968  const char* portNames[2] = { "a", "b" };
5969  std::vector<std::string> ports(portNames, portNames + 2);
5970  for (std::vector<std::string>::iterator p = ports.begin(), pe =
5971  ports.end(); p != pe; ++p) {
5972  std::string port = *p;
5973 
5974  const RAM *R = *i;
5975  std::string name = R->getName();
5976  RTLSignal *s;
5977  s = rtl->addWire(name + "_address_" + port,
5978  RTLWidth(R->getAddrWidth()));
5979  s->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
5980  s = rtl->addWire(name + "_write_enable_" + port);
5981  s->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
5982  s = rtl->addWire(name + "_in_" + port,
5983  RTLWidth(R->getDataWidth()));
5984  s->setDefaultDriver(ZERO);
5985  rtl->addWire(name + "_out_" + port,
5986  RTLWidth(R->getDataWidth()));
5987  }
5988  }
5989 }
5990 
5991 // this function is used to create memory_controller_storage_port signal
5992 // inside a parallel function, which is used to store the data from memory
5993 // in the correct cycle (two state after memory read)
5994 // For parallel functions, loads are taken from
5995 // memory_controller_storage_port signal instead of the regular
5996 // memory_controller_out_port signal
5997 void GenerateRTL::createMemoryReaddataStorageForParallelFunction() {
5998 
5999  // create shift register to indicate when the data is valid
6000  // the data is valid in the first cycle
6001  // of the finish state of the load
6002  // i.e two states after load when memory access latency = 2
6003  RTLSignal *firstStateAfterMemoryRead = rtl->addReg("first_state_after_memory_read");
6004  RTLSignal *secondStateAfterMemoryRead = rtl->addReg("second_state_after_memory_read");
6005  RTLSignal *wait = rtl->find("memory_controller_waitrequest");
6006 
6007  // invert the waitrequest and register it
6008  // this gives the signal that is asserted high
6009  // in the very first cycle of a state
6010  RTLOp *notWait = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Not)->setOperands(wait);
6011  RTLSignal *notWait_reg = rtl->addReg("memory_controller_waitrequest_inverted_reg");
6012  notWait_reg->connect(notWait);
6013 
6014  // port A read (but not write)
6015  RTLSignal *memRead_portA = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(
6016  rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_a"),
6017  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Not)->setOperands(
6018  rtl->find("memory_controller_write_enable_a")));
6019  // port B read (but not write)
6020  RTLSignal *memRead_portB = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(
6021  rtl->find("memory_controller_enable_b"),
6022  rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Not)->setOperands(
6023  rtl->find("memory_controller_write_enable_b")));
6024 
6025  // when there is a read (port A read or port B read)
6026  RTLSignal *memRead = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::Or)->setOperands(
6027  memRead_portA, memRead_portB);
6028 
6029  // make 2 bit-shift register
6030  // this signal is asserted high
6031  // in the first state after memory access
6032  RTLSignal *reset = rtl->find("reset");
6033  firstStateAfterMemoryRead->addCondition(reset, ZERO);
6034  firstStateAfterMemoryRead->addCondition(notWait, memRead);
6035  // this signal is asserted high
6036  // in the second state after memory access
6037  secondStateAfterMemoryRead->addCondition(reset, ZERO);
6038  secondStateAfterMemoryRead->addCondition(notWait, firstStateAfterMemoryRead);
6039 
6040  // create a memory readdata valid signal
6041  // which is asserted in the first cycle of
6042  // two states after a memory read
6043  RTLSignal *memReaddataValid = rtl->addWire("memory_readdata_valid");
6044  memReaddataValid = rtl->addOp(RTLOp::And)->setOperands(
6045  secondStateAfterMemoryRead, notWait_reg);
6046 
6047  createMemoryReaddataStorageForPort(memReaddataValid, secondStateAfterMemoryRead, "_a");
6048  createMemoryReaddataStorageForPort(memReaddataValid, secondStateAfterMemoryRead, "_b");
6049 }
6050 
6051 
6052 void GenerateRTL::createMemoryReaddataStorageForPort(RTLSignal *memReaddataValid,
6053  RTLSignal *secondStateAfterMemoryRead, std::string postfix) {
6054 
6055  RTLSignal *reset = rtl->find("reset");
6056  // create registers to store memory readdata
6057  // on memory readdata valid
6058  RTLSignal *memReaddata_stored = rtl->
6059  addWire("memory_controller_out_stored_on_datavalid" + postfix,
6060  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1"));
6061  RTLSignal *memReaddata_stored_reg = rtl->
6062  addReg("memory_controller_out_stored_on_datavalid_reg" + postfix,
6063  RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1"));
6064  RTLSignal *memReaddata = rtl->find("memory_controller_out" + postfix);
6065 
6066  // the logic is
6067  // memReaddata_stored = 0; (needs to be set to 0 esp. for loop pipelining)
6068  // if (memReaddataValid)
6069  // memReaddata_stored = memReaddata; (actual valid data)
6070  // if (secondStateAfterMemoryRead)
6071  // memReaddata_stored = memReaddata_stored_reg; (needs to retain data if waitrequest is asserted)
6072  memReaddata_stored->setDefaultDriver(rtl->addConst("0", RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1")));
6073  memReaddata_stored->addCondition(secondStateAfterMemoryRead, memReaddata_stored_reg);
6074  memReaddata_stored->addCondition(memReaddataValid, memReaddata);
6075 
6076  // registered value created to retain valid data
6077  memReaddata_stored_reg->addCondition(reset,
6078  rtl->addConst("0", RTLWidth("`MEMORY_CONTROLLER_DATA_SIZE-1")));
6079  memReaddata_stored_reg->addCondition(memReaddataValid, memReaddata);
6080 }
6081 
6082 
6083 // connect all registers to wires
6084 // the FSM must be finalized before doing this
6085 void GenerateRTL::connectRegistersToWires() {
6086  for (inst_iterator i = inst_begin(Fp), e = inst_end(Fp); i != e; ++i) {
6087  Instruction *I = &*i;
6088  if (ignoreInstruction(I) || isa<PHINode>(I))
6089  continue;
6090  if (I->hasNUses(0))
6091  continue; // ignore instructions with no uses
6092  std::string wire = verilogName(*I);
6093  std::string reg = wire + "_reg";
6094 
6095  // errs() << "Adding " << reg << " to state: " <<
6096  // sched->getFSM(Fp)->getEndState(I)->getName() << "\n";
6097  connectSignalToDriverInState(rtl->find(reg), rtl->find(wire),
6098  sched->getFSM(Fp)->getEndState(I), I,
6099  OUTPUT_READY);
6100  }
6101 }
6102 
6103 /*
6104  //this returns true if function F is a Pthread calling wrapper function
6105  //returns false otherwise
6106  //pthreadF is stored a pointer to the pthread function
6107  bool GenerateRTL::isaPthreadCallWrapper(Function *F, Function **pthreadF) {
6108 
6109  for (Function::const_iterator BB = F->begin(), EE = F->end(); BB != EE; ++BB) {
6110  for (BasicBlock::const_iterator I = BB->begin(), EE = BB->end(); I != EE; ++I) {
6111  if (const CallInst *CI = dyn_cast<CallInst>(I)) {
6112  if (getMetadataStr(CI, "TYPE") == "pthread_function") {
6113  *pthreadF = CI->getCalledFunction();
6114  return true;
6115  }
6116  }
6117  }
6118  }
6119  return false;
6120  }
6121  */
6122 // this returns true if function F is a Pthread calling wrapper function
6123 // which should have a return value (pthread function has a returnval)
6124 // returns false otherwise
6125 //
6126 // each pthread calling wrapper with a returnVal has a call to __legup_preserve_value
6127 // which has a metadata set as legup_wrapper_pthreadcall
6128 bool GenerateRTL::isaPthreadCallWrapperWithReturnVal(Function *F) {
6129 
6130  std::string funcName;
6131  for (Function::const_iterator BB = F->begin(), EE = F->end(); BB != EE;
6132  ++BB) {
6133  for (BasicBlock::const_iterator I = BB->begin(), EE = BB->end();
6134  I != EE; ++I) {
6135  if (const CallInst *CI = dyn_cast<CallInst>(I)) {
6136 
6137  Function *calledFunction = CI->getCalledFunction();
6138  // ignore indirect function calls
6139  if (!calledFunction)
6140  continue;
6141 
6142  funcName = calledFunction->getName();
6143  if (funcName == "__legup_preserve_value"
6144  && getMetadataStr(CI, "TYPE")
6145  == "dummyCallforPthreadReturnVal") {
6146  return true;
6147  }
6148  }
6149  /* if (const ReturnInst *retInst = dyn_cast<ReturnInst>(I)) {
6150  if (getMetadataStr(retInst, "TYPE") == "legup_wrapper_pthreadcall") {
6151  return true;
6152  }
6153  }*/
6154  }
6155  }
6156  return false;
6157 }
6158 
6159 //this returns true if function F has a return value
6160 //returns false otherwise
6161 bool GenerateRTL::hasReturnVal(Function *F) {
6162 
6163  if (!(F->getReturnType()->isVoidTy())) {
6164  return true;
6165  } else {
6166  return false;
6167  }
6168 }
6169 
6170 // the FSM used by binding needs to be modified to handle pipelining
6171 // in the default FSM, all the instructions in a pipeline are added
6172 // to one state, the pipeline_wait state. Instead, we would like to
6173 // create a new FSM that includes a states for 0 to II-1 of the pipeline
6174 void GenerateRTL::createBindingFSM() {
6175  assert(fsm);
6176 
6177  if (!LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("PIPELINE_RESOURCE_SHARING")) {
6178  this->bindingFSM = this->fsm;
6179  return;
6180  }
6181 
6182  // first clone FSM
6183  this->bindingFSM = new FiniteStateMachine();
6184  this->fsm->cloneFSM(this->bindingFSM);
6185 
6186  for (FiniteStateMachine::iterator state = this->bindingFSM->begin();
6187  state != this->bindingFSM->end(); state++) {
6188  if (!state->isWaitingForPipeline())
6189  continue;
6190  modifyPipelineState(state);
6191  }
6192 
6193  std::string fileName = "fsm.pipeline." + getLabel(Fp) + ".dot";
6194  printFSMDotFile(this->bindingFSM, fileName);
6195 }
6196 
6197 void GenerateRTL::modifyPipelineState(State *state) {
6198  assert(state->isWaitingForPipeline());
6199 
6200  // Note: the pipeline wait state has no instructions in it, except for
6201  // phi nodes.
6202 
6203  // get rid of loop back
6204  State *nextStateAfterBB = getStateAfterLoop(state);
6205 
6206  BasicBlock *BB = state->getBasicBlock();
6207  assert(BB);
6208  state->setName("pipeline_time_0");
6209  int II = getPipelineII(BB);
6210  assert(II >= 1);
6211  std::map<int, State*> newStates;
6212  newStates[0] = state;
6213  State *prevState = state;
6214  for (int time = 1; time < II; time++) {
6215  std::string name = "pipeline_time_" + utostr(time);
6216  State *newState = this->bindingFSM->newState(prevState, name);
6217  newState->setName(name);
6218  newState->setBasicBlock(BB);
6219  if (prevState) {
6220  prevState->setDefaultTransition(newState);
6221  }
6222  newStates[time] = newState;
6223  prevState = newState;
6224  }
6225  assert((int )newStates.size() == II);
6226  int lastTime = II - 1;
6227  if (lastTime != 0) {
6228 
6229  newStates[lastTime]->setTerminating(true);
6230  newStates[lastTime]->setDefaultTransition(nextStateAfterBB);
6231 
6232  // clear original wait state
6233  state->setTerminating(false);
6234  State::Transition blank;
6235  state->setTransition(blank);
6236  state->setDefaultTransition(newStates[1]);
6237  assert(state->getNumTransitions() == 1);
6238 
6239  }
6240 
6241  for (BasicBlock::iterator I = BB->begin(), ie = BB->end(); I != ie; ++I) {
6242 
6243  int startTime = getMetadataInt(I, "legup.pipeline.start_time");
6244  int timeAvail = getMetadataInt(I, "legup.pipeline.avail_time");
6245 
6246  startTime = startTime % II;
6247  timeAvail = startTime % II;
6248 
6249  // how do i handle arrival times / LVA for pipelining?
6250  newStates[startTime]->push_back(I);
6251  this->bindingFSM->setEndState(I, newStates[timeAvail]);
6252  }
6253 
6254 }
6255 
6256 void delete_multicycle_files() {
6257  static bool first_visit = true;
6258  if (!first_visit) {
6259  return;
6260  }
6261 
6262  std::vector<std::string> file_list;
6263  file_list.push_back("llvm_prof_multicycle_constraints.sdc");
6264  file_list.push_back("llvm_prof_multicycle_constraints.qsf");
6265  file_list.push_back("src_dst_pairs_with_through_constraints.txt");
6266  file_list.push_back("pairs_whose_through_constraints_must_be_removed.txt");
6267  for (std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator it = file_list.begin();
6268  it != file_list.end(); ++it) {
6269  std::ofstream file;
6270  file.open(it->c_str());
6271  file << std::endl;
6272  }
6273 
6274  first_visit = false;
6275 }
6276 
6277 RTLModule* GenerateRTL::generateRTL(MinimizeBitwidth *_MBW) {
6278 
6279  EXPLICIT_LPM_MULTS = LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("EXPLICIT_LPM_MULTS");
6280  MULTIPUMPING = LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("MULTIPUMPING");
6281  USE_MB = LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("MB_MINIMIZE_HW");
6282 
6283  MBW = _MBW;
6284 
6285  assert(!rtl);
6286  rtl = new RTLModule(Fp->getName());
6287 
6288  // check if this function uses Pthreads
6289  usesPthreads = checkforPthreads(Fp);
6290  // add to phreadfunctions
6291  if (usesPthreads)
6292  LEGUP_CONFIG->addPthreadFunction(Fp->getName());
6293 
6294  generateModuleDeclaration();
6295 
6296  createRTLSignals();
6297 
6298  // function calls are a special case because they can modify the
6299  // finite state machine. Do these first:
6300  generateAllCallInsts();
6301 
6302  // loop pipelines (which also modifies fsm)
6303  generateAllLoopPipelines();
6304 
6305  updateStatesAfterCallInsts();
6306 
6307  printFSMDot();
6308 
6309  connectRegistersToWires();
6310 
6311  binding = new BipartiteWeightedMatchingBinding(alloc, bindingFSM, Fp,
6312  this->MBW);
6313  // Patterns is used for binding graphs
6314  PatternMap * Patterns = new PatternMap(fsm);
6315  // InstructionsInGraphs is a set of all instructions in graphs, used in
6316  // visitInstruction
6317  this->InstructionsInGraphs.clear();
6318  this->GraphPairs.clear();
6319  this->binding->operatorAssignment();
6320  for (Binding::iterator i = this->binding->begin(), ie =
6321  this->binding->end(); i != ie; ++i) {
6322  Instruction *instr = i->first;
6323  std::string fuId = i->second;
6324  instructionsAssignedToFU[fuId].insert(instr);
6325  }
6326 
6327  PatternBinding *patterns = new PatternBinding(alloc, fsm, Fp, this->MBW);
6328  patterns->PatternAnalysis(*Patterns, this->AllBindingPairs,
6329  this->GraphPairs, this->InstructionsInGraphs);
6330  createBindingSignals();
6331  if (MULTIPUMPING) {
6332  createMultipumpSignals();
6333  }
6334 
6335  // for parallel functions
6336  // create a register to store the data from memory
6337  // in the correct cycle
6338  bool isParallelFunction = Fp->hasFnAttribute("totalNumThreads");
6339  if (isParallelFunction) {
6340  createMemoryReaddataStorageForParallelFunction();
6341  }
6342 
6343  generateDatapath();
6344  updateRTLWithPatterns();
6345  shareRegistersFromBinding();
6346  delete Patterns;
6347  Patterns = NULL;
6348 
6349  printSchedulingInfo();
6350 
6351  // Delete/clear multi-cycle files from previous builds
6352  delete_multicycle_files();
6353  printSDCMultiCycleConstraints();
6354 
6355  printScheduleGanttChart();
6356 
6357  // must be run after the above because the FSM can be modified by
6358  // modifyFSMForLoopPipeline()
6359  timingAnalysis(dag);
6360 
6361  std::string functionType;
6362  std::set<CallInst *> pthreadFunctions;
6363  // Module instances
6364  for (Function::iterator b = Fp->begin(), be = Fp->end(); b != be; ++b) {
6365  for (BasicBlock::iterator instr = b->begin(), ie = b->end();
6366  instr != ie; ++instr) {
6367 
6368  if (isaDummyCall(instr))
6369  continue;
6370 
6371  if (CallInst *CI = dyn_cast<CallInst>(instr)) {
6372  functionType = getMetadataStr(CI, "TYPE");
6373 
6374  // don't generate instances for pthread poll wrapper
6375  if (functionType != "legup_wrapper_pthreadpoll") {
6376  // push pthread functions into vector
6377  // to be used for creating arbiter
6378  if (getMetadataStr(CI, "TYPE") ==
6379  "legup_wrapper_pthreadcall")
6380  pthreadFunctions.insert(CI);
6381  // instantiate module
6382  generateVariableDeclarations(CI, functionType);
6383  }
6384  }
6385  }
6386  }
6387 
6388  // create arbiter for pthreads
6389  if (!pthreadFunctions.empty()) {
6390  generatePthreadArbiter(pthreadFunctions);
6391  generatePthreadMasterThreadLogic();
6392  }
6393 
6394  // debugging: display cur_state each cycle
6395  if (LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("PRINT_STATES")) {
6396  std::string old_body = rtl->getBody();
6397  raw_string_ostream body(old_body);
6398  body << "always @(posedge clk)" << "\n";
6399  body << "\t$display(\"Cycle: %d Time: %d " << Fp->getName()
6400  << " cur_state: %d\", ($time-50)/20, $time, cur_state);\n";
6401  rtl->setBody(body.str());
6402  }
6403 
6404  // add local rams
6405  for (std::map<RAM*, Function*>::iterator i =
6406  alloc->isLocalFunctionRam.begin(), e =
6407  alloc->isLocalFunctionRam.end(); i != e; ++i) {
6408  RAM *r = i->first;
6409  Function *f = i->second;
6410  if (Fp == f) {
6411  // RAM is local to this function
6412  assert(rtl->localRamList.find(r) == rtl->localRamList.end());
6413  rtl->localRamList.insert(r);
6414  }
6415  }
6416 
6417  return rtl;
6418 }
6419 
6420 // Get the number of succcessors that are in the same state
6421 int GenerateRTL::getNumSuccInState(Instruction *I, FiniteStateMachine *fsm) {
6422  State *currS = fsm->getStartState(I);
6423  int numSuccInState = 0;
6424  for (Value::user_iterator i = I->user_begin(), e = I->user_end(); i != e;
6425  ++i) {
6426  Instruction *successor = dyn_cast<Instruction>(*i);
6427  if (!successor)
6428  continue;
6429  State *succS = fsm->getStartState(successor);
6430  if (succS == currS)
6431  numSuccInState++;
6432  }
6433  return numSuccInState;
6434 }
6435 
6436 // Check if an instruction is the start of a path
6437 bool GenerateRTL::isStartOfPath(SchedulerDAG *dag, Instruction *I,
6438  FiniteStateMachine *fsm) {
6439  State *beginS = fsm->getStartState(I);
6440  InstructionNode *IN = dag->getInstructionNode(I);
6441  int numPreInState = 0;
6442  int numAllPre = 0;
6443  for (InstructionNode::iterator i = IN->dep_begin(), e = IN->dep_end();
6444  i != e; ++i) {
6445  // dependency from dep -> IN
6446  Instruction *dep = (*i)->getInst();
6447  State *endS = fsm->getStartState(dep);
6448  numAllPre++;
6449  if (endS == beginS)
6450  numPreInState++;
6451  }
6452  int numPreOutOfState = numAllPre - numPreInState;
6453 
6454  // An instruction is the start of a path in two cases
6455  // either it doesn't has any predecessor in the same state or it has some predecessor out of the state
6456  if (numPreInState == 0 || numPreOutOfState != 0)
6457  return true;
6458  else
6459  return false;
6460 }
6461 
6462 // calculate the delay of all paths starting from the beginning of a state and ending with Instruction *Root
6463 // Store the paths in func_path
6464 // gets called for every root instruction
6465 void GenerateRTL::calculateDelay(SchedulerDAG *dag, Instruction *Curr,
6466  float partialDelay, State *rootState, FiniteStateMachine *fsm,
6467  std::list<GenerateRTL::PATH*> *func_path,
6468  std::vector<Instruction *> instrs, std::vector<float> instrDelays) {
6469  int ifNotIgnoreGetelementptrAndStore = LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt(
6470  "TIMING_NO_IGNORE_GETELEMENTPTR_AND_STORE");
6471  InstructionNode *CurrNode = dag->getInstructionNode(Curr);
6472  float dl;
6473  // Ignore getelementptr and store instructions
6474  if (ifNotIgnoreGetelementptrAndStore == 0)
6475  if (isa<GetElementPtrInst>(Curr) || isa<StoreInst>(*Curr))
6476  return;
6477  dl = partialDelay + CurrNode->getDelay();
6478 
6479  // Add the instruction into the Path
6480  instrs.push_back(Curr);
6481  instrDelays.push_back(CurrNode->getDelay());
6482 
6483  // Walk through the dependencies
6484  for (InstructionNode::iterator i = CurrNode->dep_begin(), e =
6485  CurrNode->dep_end(); i != e; ++i) {
6486  // dependency from dep -> CurrNode
6487  Instruction *dep = (*i)->getInst();
6488  State *currState = fsm->getStartState(dep);
6489  // recursive call to discover other instructions if dep is in the same state
6490  if (currState == rootState)
6491  calculateDelay(dag, dep, dl, rootState, fsm, func_path, instrs,
6492  instrDelays);
6493  }
6494 
6495  bool ifAddToPath = isStartOfPath(dag, Curr, fsm);
6496  // Add the path into the list if current node is the start of the path
6497  if (ifAddToPath) {
6498  PATH *temp;
6499  temp = new PATH;
6500  temp->pathDelay = dl;
6501  temp->state = rootState;
6502  temp->instructions = instrs;
6503  temp->instrDelay = instrDelays;
6504  temp->func = Fp;
6505  func_path->push_back(temp);
6506  }
6507 }
6508 
6509 // Print out the n longest paths
6510 void GenerateRTL::printPath(raw_ostream &report, list<PATH*> *path) {
6511  int num_paths = LEGUP_CONFIG->getParameterInt("TIMING_NUM_PATHS");
6512  int pathNum = 0;
6513  for (std::list<GenerateRTL::PATH*>::iterator i = path->begin(), e =
6514  path->end(); i != e; ++i) {
6515  pathNum++;
6516  if (pathNum > num_paths)
6517  break;
6518  PATH *curr = *i;
6519  report << "-----------------Function: " << curr->func->getName()
6520  << "---------------\n";
6521  report << "-------------------------" << pathNum
6522  << "---------------------------\n";
6523  report << "-----------------Delay of path:" << ftostr(curr->pathDelay)
6524  << " ns---------------\n";
6525  report << "-----------------State:" << curr->state->getName()
6526  << "-----------------\n";
6527  float partialDelay = 0;
6528  int instrNum = curr->instrDelay.size();
6529  for (std::vector<Instruction *>::reverse_iterator i =
